13 2021-07-14 dizziness Around 7PM on June 19th, she had chest pain and chest pressure. She also had a mild headache. She wa... Read more
Close
Around 7PM on June 19th, she had chest pain and chest pressure. She also had a mild headache. She was taking a walk in the neighborhood and had to come home because she was experiencing shortness of breath and having difficulty breathing. She described it as an electric shock/shooting pain in her chest area, on both sides. I took her (the participant) to the ER. While at the ER, she started to feel experience pain and tingling in her left thigh. It would feel better if her leg was elevated. The leg pain subsided by the 20th. On the 21st, she was taken back to the ER because the chest pain and shortness of breath was not subsiding. They did another EKG which showed no abnormalities. Blood work came back with the same indication of virus/inflammation. They gave her a pain med (not sure of the exact name, but it is used for patients after surgery) and an IV. Also given a prescription for 27ml of ibuprofen with Tylenol in between. Two days later, on the 23rd, she had an appointment with the pediatrician. The doctor checked muscle tone and listened to her chest. My daughter gets fatigued by going up a single flight of stairs. Doctor referred her to a pediatric cardiologist. Later that night of the 23rd, she began to get a tingling sensation in her left arm that went down to her hands and lightheadedness. She was not able to move and had to lay down. Being upright made the pressure in her chest worse and she had to take shallow breaths. I took her to the ER. They did a chest x-ray that showed no abnormalities. Referred her for an echo cardiogram on the 24th. She was doing better after that until July 5th, when the pressure and pain started getting worse again. I took her to the pediatrician again and they referred her to rheumatologist on the 11th of July. The rheumatologist prescribed a steroid medication to calm her immune system. She said her immune system was activated and was inflamed, which is why she was experiencing the shortness of breath and pain. She prescribed her colchicine and Aleve. Since she has started to take the meds, she is doing better but she is still experiencing pressure at a lesser level. The pain is the same level that feels like static shock.
13 2021-07-14 dizziness Pt received shot in pharmacy for second covid pfizer vaccine. She sat down for 15 minutes, but then... Read more
Close
Pt received shot in pharmacy for second covid pfizer vaccine. She sat down for 15 minutes, but then got up and felt lightheadness. However, she continued shopping in store with her family. On the way out, she was still feeling lightheadness and her vision was lessened so she sat down at the food court area. Pharmacist was alerted to come attend to her. Pharmacist suggested that she put her head between her legs and offered wet towel for her neck. After about 5 minutes, she said she was fine to go with her family.

Close
Site: Pain at Injection Site-Mild, Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Severe, Systemic: Flushed / Sweating-Medium, Systemic: Hypotension-Severe, Systemic: Nausea-Medium, Systemic: Shakiness-Medium, Systemic: Weakness-Severe, Additional Details: Patient presented about 10 min after vaccination as lightheaded and nauseous. Patient vomited one time. EMS was contacted, when they arrived the patient's BP was 90/60 and HR was 88 bmp. Parent of patient refused hospital transport after EMS gave all clear, and patient was able to talk, stand, etc on her own. Mother stated that patient was very anxious before and during the vaccine.

Close

14 2021-05-12 dizziness 14 y/o female presented to observation after receiving covid-19 pfizer vaccine c/o of dizziness and ... Read more
Close
14 y/o female presented to observation after receiving covid-19 pfizer vaccine c/o of dizziness and expressing syncope after lying down for ten minutes in the vaccination station. Pt V/S as follows; at 1332; 79/49 53 12 and O2 100% RA in supine position with legs elevated. Pt continued to express dizziness. Pt reposition to seating after ten minutes. Pt V/S as follows at 1340; 86/50 57 16 and O2 100% RA. Pt provided water and chips. Pt reposition to standing after ten minutes. Pt V/S as follows at 1350; 76/45 57 16 and O2 100% RA. Pt express feeling dizzy after standing. Pt advised to reposition to sitting. Pt V/S while sitting at 1400 are as followed 85/55 53 16 and O2 100%. Pt then advised to stand and try to ambulate once ready. Pt stands and expressed they felt fine and was ready to ambulate. Pt ambulated thirty feet without assistance. Pt VS after standing and ambulating at 1209 as followed; 84/54 63 18 and O2 100% RA. Mom stated PCP reports SBP of 90 in March via phone. Pt and Pt mother advised to follow up with PCP prior to playing Baseball next day. Pt DC after displaying steady gait after ambulating, eating chips, drinking a full bottle of water Pt stating "no longer feeling dizzy" and VS taken at 1409. Supervisor notified.
14 2021-05-12 dizziness Nausea, dry heaving, felt dizzy at the time of injection. At 09:48: pulse: 98 then 87 Respiration; 1... Read more
Close
Nausea, dry heaving, felt dizzy at the time of injection. At 09:48: pulse: 98 then 87 Respiration; 16 SPO2: 98%BP: 90/60 Observed and gave water and crackers, at 9:50 she felt much better and discharged home
14 2021-05-12 dizziness Pt c/o of dizziness as the only symptom s/p vaccination. She denied any chest pain, shortness of br... Read more
Close
Pt c/o of dizziness as the only symptom s/p vaccination. She denied any chest pain, shortness of breath, vision loss, or pain. Pt's mother stated that she previously gets dizzy after vaccinations, and seeing needles. Pt stated that she had a "fear" of needles, but wanted the vaccine anyway. The nurse moved the pt to the private area, and helped her onto the stretcher, where she laid down. After the pt was lying down, the nurse assessed her. The nurse then took vital signs every ten minutes, listened to her lung sounds, assessed the radial pulse, assessed her vision, and mentation. After 15 minutes the pt sat upright with her feet dangled. With the nurse and the mother ten minutes later, the pt was walked down the hall. No issues were noted and the pt was stable. All the vitals were within normal limits throughout the entire time. The previous dizziness was gone, and the mother stated that she looked great. Pt stated a total of 40 minutes and then was safely discharged.

Close
Patient came to the pharmacy with her mother to receive her scheduled first dose of covid Pfizer vaccine. Patient seemed fine after the receiving the vaccine and once I turned around to inform the patient to stay within the premises of the pharmacy for 15 minutes, the patient fell back on the chair and seemed unconscious so her mother and I held her and I had a pharmacy tech call 911 and followed their procedure over the phone until EMS arrived to the pharmacy.
14 2021-05-13 dizziness light headed nausea dizziness down for 45 minutes
14 2021-05-13 dizziness Patient started vomiting after administration of first dose of Pfizer. First dose was administered a... Read more
Close
Patient started vomiting after administration of first dose of Pfizer. First dose was administered at 15:16 and patient felt dizzy, c/o of headache and started vomiting right afterwards. Charge RN, ANM, and onsite provider was notified. Moved patient to triage area and her VS were as follow: BP: 96/50; HR: 73, SPO2: 98%. Patient was given a peppermint gum to chew and water. Patient felt better five minutes later. Patient stable, and released into the observation area for 30 minutes. Patient was accompanied by father d/c to home stable steady gait. Pt advised to seek emergency services for any further sx.

As rph wasn't unsure the disease's effect on covid 19 vacicne. Rph asked pt to stay in resting area for 30 minutes. 14 2021-05-14 dizziness A 14-year-old female received her COVID vaccine. After about 5 minutes of sitting in the chair for ... Read more
Close
A 14-year-old female received her COVID vaccine. After about 5 minutes of sitting in the chair for her 15 minute observation, her mom said she felt nauseous and like she was going to pass out. She was laid her back in the chair. The patient's mother went to get orange juice. She was pale and her eyes were rolling back in her head. She did pass out for a few seconds, and I checked the patient's pulse and blood pressure. BP 139/58, pulse 53. By that point she was coming back around. After she sat for several minutes and had orange juice and water, she was feeling much better.
14 2021-05-14 dizziness Approx. 5 min after vaccination patient started to feel dizzy. Technician went to retrieve ice packs... Read more
Close
Approx. 5 min after vaccination patient started to feel dizzy. Technician went to retrieve ice packs and patient fainted. Pharmacist gently moved patient to her side on the floor and brought knees up to her chest while technician called 911. Patient regained consciousness after approx. 2 minutes before EMS arrived on scene. EMS took patient's blood pressure (hypotensive), administered saline drip in ambulance onsite then released patient to parents. Followed up with parents next day, patient was monitored at home and was feeling fine. Per EMS patient most likely was dehydrated. No prior history of event post vaccine.

14 2021-05-14 fall Pt received vaccine while seated and when she stood to go to observation area she experienced syncop... Read more
Close
Pt received vaccine while seated and when she stood to go to observation area she experienced syncope and fell supine to tile floor. No LOC, was A&Ox4 immediately. Pale, strong pulses, RRR P 60's, unlabored resp effort. BP not evaluated. Some nausea, no vomiting. Exam of head revealed mild TTP with no open wound, swelling, or depression. Pt responded to rest and required no intervention. Pt was monitored x 60 mins with full resolution of sx and discharged to home in good condtion.
14 2021-05-15 dizziness Within 10 minutes after the vaccination, there were some body tremors and dizziness, then she lost v... Read more
Close
Within 10 minutes after the vaccination, there were some body tremors and dizziness, then she lost vision, hearing and ability to speak for a few seconds, followed by difficulty breathing and a feeling of her heart ?jumping out of chest.? Eventually, she recovered, but her right hand (not the injection arm) still has involuntary tremors, which has not gone away.
14 2021-05-15 dizziness Patient fainted about 10 minutes after receiving first dose of Covid-19 vaccine. She was instructed... Read more
Close
Patient fainted about 10 minutes after receiving first dose of Covid-19 vaccine. She was instructed to remain seated in the waiting room but got up and walked around the store with her parents and felt faint after walking for a minute or two. She passed out and was caught by her dad and gently laid down on the floor. Paramedics were called to check vitals as patient continued to feel drowsy for a few minutes. She was assessed by paramedics and released to parents after checking vitals, blood glucose, heart. She stated she was feeling better after several minutes of sitting or laying down.

14 2021-05-15 gait disturbance, dizziness Approximately 5 minutes after receiving vaccination, patient reportedly became dizzy and stumbled in... Read more
Close
Approximately 5 minutes after receiving vaccination, patient reportedly became dizzy and stumbled into a floor display in the waiting area. Mother, who was with patient, states there was no loss of consciousness. Patient then sat in chair and after a few minutes stated symptoms began to resolve. Patient stated having a brief period of fuzzy vision. No signs of an allergic reaction were noted. Patient stayed in waiting area for approximately 1/2 and during that time stated symptoms had completed resolved. Patient then left the store.
14 2021-05-16 dizziness, vertigo Vaccination was on Saturday, within 10 minutes of the vaccination, my child reported her ears felt l... Read more
Close
Vaccination was on Saturday, within 10 minutes of the vaccination, my child reported her ears felt like they were popping, she felt dizzy, tight throat and jaw pain. On site nurses gave her apple juice and crackers. She reported feeling unwell, dizzy, light-headed, jaw pain and short of breath the following day, on Sunday. On Monday, we took her to urgent care for same symptoms - unwell, dizzy, light-headed, jaw pain, short of breath. Rapid COVID test and strep test were negative, EKG was normal. Urgent care doctor says it is vertigo.
14 2021-05-16 dizziness Patient was given her first Pfizer Covid shot in her LUA at 3:15. After the shot one of the school n... Read more
Close
Patient was given her first Pfizer Covid shot in her LUA at 3:15. After the shot one of the school nurses notice during observation that she stood up and looked lie she wanted to pass out. The nurse accompanied the patient to a nearby cot where she laid her down. The patient c/o lightheadedness, dry fuzzy throat. Patient's extremities were cold to touch, eyes rolling back, hand posturing (stiff and cold), shaking., 62 pulse. No problems breathing or swollen throat. Blood pressure was 119/67 at 3:25 and pulse was 80. Nurse elevated patient legs for about 10 minutes, patient felt dizzy, shaking, apparent panicking eyes still rolling back. She was able to respond to simple commands. Still fuzzy throat. Administer 50mg IM in RUE at 3:34p.m. Blood pressure 116/71 at 3:35. Patient's face cheeks started to look red and warm. Blood pressure 123/76 at 3:39p.m. We called 911 at 3:46p.m. Blood pressure 117/78 at 3:52, temperature 97.5 degrees. Paramedics arrived 3:54p.m. Blood pressure taken by paramedics:142/86, O2 saturation 70%, started oxygen via nasal canula at 3:56. Gave epinephrine 0.5ml IM in left upper thigh. Started IV line at 4:00p.m. Red tonsils, lungs diminished but clear. 4:02p.m. transported by paramedics to Hospital.

14 2021-05-16 dizziness 14 year old female with a CC of lightheadedness about 8 minutes after her first dose of Pfizer. Sta... Read more
Close
14 year old female with a CC of lightheadedness about 8 minutes after her first dose of Pfizer. States she also noted mild nausea. I asked the patient to elevate her legs and she states her symptoms resolved. I also had the patient drink more water at that time. No wheezing, no hives, no toungue, lips, or throat swelling. No vomiting. Vitals signs were stable, oxygen saturation 98%. EMS was not called and mother and patient decided not to go to ED for follow-up as the patient has a history of vasovagal syncope around needles and states this response is normal for her.
14 2021-05-16 dizziness Starting at 0300 5/16/21 Pt was awoken with pain in R arm, R arm pit, and along back. Pain kept wak... Read more
Close
Starting at 0300 5/16/21 Pt was awoken with pain in R arm, R arm pit, and along back. Pain kept waking Pt up, she slept fitfully. Pt stayed in bed until around 1300 5/16/21. She had a project for school due- had to video tape making a recipe. She was standing up videotaping the ingredients when she felt very dizzy. Pt then reported that she lost her vision- everything turned black. I had to rush to her to catch her- she had loss of consciousness for about a minute. She was very pale- lips turned blue. She had a pulse the whole time, BP was 117/60- when I checked it about 5 min later. Her temperature on a ear thermometer was 99.7. After she awoke, she was still very dizzy and stayed in bed most of the day. 5/17/21 AM- she woke up for school 0600- and was feeling better. No more dizziness, color was back in her cheeks, was able to eat and left for school.

Close
Client received 1st COVID vaccine of Pfizer (Lot# EW0182). Client reported to feel nauseated and dizzy. EMT responded at 4:18PM and informed RN . Client is accompanied by her mother sitting in the observation waiting area. Client has completed 20 minutes of observation before feeling nauseated and dizzy. At 4:18PM vital signs are BP 97/53, Pulse 56, SpO2 98%. RN consulted Client and mother in regards to ED precautions and common adverse effects of the COVID vaccination. Vital signs at 4:29PM are BP 111/68, Pulse 65, SpO2 98%. Nausea and dizziness has improved. At 4:32PM Client and mother left observation area. Client states adverse effects has resolved. Client left facility at 4:32PM with steady gate.
14 2021-05-17 dizziness Patient complained of dizziness about 5 minutes after vaccination. Patient was sitting at the clinic... Read more
Close
Patient complained of dizziness about 5 minutes after vaccination. Patient was sitting at the clinic lobby with her mother. I assisted the patient inside the exam room to lay down on the exam table. Patients was so dizzy and about to faint. She could hardly get up to the exam table. I instructed her to get up to the exam table one more time. She was able to get up and lay down on the table. Patient did not lose consciousness. Vitals were taken and were stable. Mother gave patient gatorade to drink. Patient stayed laid down on the table for about 10-15 minutes. Mother was watching the patient. Patient was fully alert and no longer feeling dizzy. Patient walked with her mother. My assistant walked them outside our facility.

Close
Patient received vaccine, stood up to walk around corner, then collapsed, hitting her head on floor. An EMT was in the area and stepped in. Pt was unresponsive for about a minute, pulse very weak. 911 was called. Pt was moved into a separate room once slightly responsive, she was very pale and seemed confused and was very nauseated. Her blood pressure dropped to 68/44, but over the course of a few minutes started coming back up. EMTs arrived and took patient to hospital to evaluate.

14 2021-05-20 dizziness Client received the 1st or 2nd COVID vaccine (Pfizer Lot # EW0185 expiration 05/22/2021) at 1312. RN... Read more
Close
Client received the 1st or 2nd COVID vaccine (Pfizer Lot # EW0185 expiration 05/22/2021) at 1312. RN vaccinated the client at 1312, the client then told her that she was feeling lightheaded and dizzy. RN alerted and they responded. EMTs alerted PHN at 1315 and vital signs were taken (blood pressure 102/60, oxygen 98, pulse 62). Skin color was appropriate to skin tone, client was alert and oriented. Client?s mother was with her and sated that the client as anxiety to needles and has passed out before from receiving a vaccine. Client stated that she did eat today. She has no medical conditions, no allergies, and is not taking any medications. Client refused Benadryl. At 1320 client stated that she was feeling a ?little better? and was escorted to zero gravity chair when dizziness and lightheadedness subsided. Client given juice which she accepted and drank. Vital signs taken at 1325 (blood pressure 118/74, respirations 18, heart rate 72, oxygen 97). Vital signs taken at 1335 (heart rate 76, oxygen 96, respiration 18, blood pressure 122/76). Client and mother provided education to seek emergency services if life threatening symptoms appear, and to follow up with primary care provider. Vital signs taken at 1345 (oxygen 97, heart rate 82, blood pressure 118/78). At 1347 client stated that she was doing fine and did not have any more symptoms. Client left with her mother at 1347 unassisted with a steady gait.

Patient had vaccine and entered waiting area for monitoring period. Started feeling dizzy and started to sit on ground but passed out while transferring to ground. Patient came to confused, pale, sweating and then proceeded to pass out 2-3 additional times. EMS was called as a precaution since patient reported feeling confused, weak, heart palpitations. Patient fainted and felt dizzy roughly after 10 minutes upon receiving the vaccine. She immediately gain consciousness but could not recall that she fainted and just said she "blacked out". The pharmacy staff took her blood pressure, and said it was low but after monitoring for 10 minutes, it went back to normal. She felt no more dizziness, was able to stand up, walk normally and went home shortly after.

Patient got her 1st dose of Pfizer vaccine, was told by provider and mother to sit down for 15 minutes. After awhile patient 's mom came back to pharmacy and alert us patient is fainting. I came to patient and she could barely stood up. patient looked pale. We assisted patient to come to pharmacy sitting area. I measured patient 's bp. BP reading was 60/43 and 70HR. Patient 's mom informed us she has not been drinking or eating breakfast, so they went to grab some snacks while waiting and that was when patient fainted. A by stander called 911 when patient first fainted. EMS came and brought patient to ER for further check up.

14 2021-05-22 dizziness Client was feeling "cold." Client was a 14-year-old female sitting upright in her observation chair,... Read more
Close
Client was feeling "cold." Client was a 14-year-old female sitting upright in her observation chair, alert and tracking with her eyes. Client had a chief complaint of dizziness and feeling cold. Client stated that she began to feel cold and dizzy a few minutes after her observation had begun. This was the client's first dose of the Pfizer vaccine. Client denied any medical history or known allergies. Assessment revealed no swelling, hives, discoloration, shortness of breath or other signs and symptoms of anaphylaxis. Client stated that she felt "cold" and "dizzy." Client stated that her only meal was the snacks provided at the vaccination site. Airway, breathing and circulation were intact. Client's initial set of vitals at 1006 was 116/78 blood pressure, 80 heart rate, respirations 16, alert and oriented to person, place, date and event. Temperature 97.8*f. EMTs present were unable to obtain an O2 sat due to client's nail but client was negative for signs of shortness of breath. Client was asked to lie down until her complaint was resolved. Client was provided with food and was able to eat without difficulty. Client was reassessed every 15 minutes due to her stability. Vitals were as follows: 1011 - 108/78, 84, resp. 14 1021 108/78, 88, resp 14 1029 - 108/78, 80, resp 16. After approximately 10 minutes, the client denied any symptoms and was asked to sit up in an observation chair for the remainder of her observation. Client and her mother were instructed to seek emergency care if signs or symptoms of an allergic reaction occur later this evening.

Pt c/o dizziness. BP 121/69, HR 68, RR 18 -- > 103/68, 67, 18. Pt reports that she did not drink much water today. Pt given water and juice, laid down/rest. Pt reports feeling much better after laying down. Pt stable and released from the vaccination site.

HR 90 BP: 104/58 RR: 18 O2Sat: 100% Temp 98.3. Nine minutes later she was asymptomatic. HR: 90 BP: 110/50 RR: 20 O2 Sat: 100 Temp: 98.2. 10 minutes later still asymptomatic. Assisted to sitting position then vitals taken HR: 84 BP: 112/62 RR: 20 O2 Sat: 98 Temp: 98.2. She remained asymptomatic. Assisted to a standing position, Asymptomatic. Discharged to home with her mother. Able to independently walk out of the clinic.

14 2021-05-23 dizziness Approximately 2 hours after receiving her first covid vaccine, my 14 year old fainted. She was stand... Read more
Close
Approximately 2 hours after receiving her first covid vaccine, my 14 year old fainted. She was standing in our kitchen at home and became dizzy and started falling backwards. She said her vision was black, she was hot, her head hurt, I could see sweat on her face and chest, and she said she was having tightness in her chest/not able to get full breaths. She didn't totally lose consciousness, but she was disoriented. These symptoms lasted a few minutes, then she felt fine.
14 2021-05-23 dizziness I administered the Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine to the patient (14 year old) she was very anxious, after ... Read more
Close
I administered the Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine to the patient (14 year old) she was very anxious, after giving it to her she sat in the post-IMZ waiting area on the chair. Her mother was next to her. In a few minutes she told her mother she was feeling dizzy and started to fall off the chair. Her mother caught her and yelled to us for help. We called code white and 911. She recovered in a few minutes and he gave her an ice pak as she was hot. She sat on the floor with her mother. She stood up after she felt better and sat on the chair and then she got pale again and looked like she was about to faint again. The fire department had arrived and they checked on her. By then she was a lot better. They decided that it was not necessary to call an ambulance and went home. We gave her a bottle of water. I followed up with the mother at 7 pm and she was doing a lot better

Close
Following routine volleyball practice, patient developed heartburn, lightheadedness, and palpitations. Elevated heart rate noted by this reporter (mom and also RN), called Peds on-call and were directed to ED. Patient was found to be in SVT with heart rate over 250. After several tries, able to reduce HR to 110-120 range with vagal maneuvers, discharged home to follow-up with pediatric cardiology (patient has no medical history). Correlation unknown and long-term effects yet unknown (currently wearing long-term heart monitor with other testing and follow-up pending).

14 2021-05-27 gait disturbance, dizziness Approximately five minutes after the vaccination, patient became very light-headed and nauseated wit... Read more
Close
Approximately five minutes after the vaccination, patient became very light-headed and nauseated with loss of vision. She was offered water and hard candy while waiting for the paramedics to arrive. She took a small amount of each, but declined anything else from the store. She seemed to be in significant distress and had difficulty moving to the immunization room where she would be out of view from others in the store. Parmedics arrived and checked her vitals and said those looked ok, so they didn't seem concerned. Patient still seemed very unsteady when leaving, but did say that her vision had improved. Patients were advised to keep a very close eye on her.
14 2021-05-29 dizziness, fall Patient fainted after vaccine given and fell from the exam table onto the floor landing on her left... Read more
Close
Patient fainted after vaccine given and fell from the exam table onto the floor landing on her left side bumping the left side of her head and left shoulder. An ambulance was called. She quickly regained consciousness after approximately 10 seconds. She was alert and oriented to place, date and her birthday. She was able to move all extremities with 5/5 strength; no misalignment, asymmetry, or defects noted in head, neck, spine and major joints. She had full range of motion in all extremities and neck . Pupils equal and react to light. Left side of head above ear was slightly tender without any defects. Left shoulder was slightly tender to palpation anteriorly without difficulty with full range of motion. There were no bruises noted. She denied any difficulty breathing. BP was 88/60 and HR 125. After evaluation and assessment, patient was stable and the ambulance was cancelled per father's request. Patient remained in clinic and drank approximately 8 oz of water without difficulty. Patient's blood pressure was checked standing after 45 minutes and patient became slightly light headed again. Patient was instructed to remain in the clinic for 15 more minutes. Patient's blood pressure was re-evaluated and was 84/60 after standing for 2 minutes; she was asymptomatic and denies feeling like she would faint. HR 100. Discussed signs and symptoms of a concussion, warning signs to monitor (sleepiness, difficulty moving, headache, or vomiting), and when to go to ER. Father verbalizes understanding. Patient was able to walk out of the clinic with father and brother in a stable condition. Patient instructed to f/u with doctor in two days or ER sooner if worsening

14 2021-05-29 dizziness Pt received her 1st dose of the Pfizer vaccine in the right arm at approximately 2:45 PM on May 29 a... Read more
Close
Pt received her 1st dose of the Pfizer vaccine in the right arm at approximately 2:45 PM on May 29 at pharmacy. Pt was recommended to sit for 15 minutes in the waiting area after vaccination for observation, but she and mom opted to go shopping in the store. At approximately 3:37 PM, pt and mom came back to the pharmacy to tell me (the pharmacist) that she had hives and showed me red bumps on her left arm. I had the pt sit while mom went to go buy Benadryl. After 5 minutes, I checked on the pt. She had taken one dose of Benadryl and stated that she was dizzy and feeling itchy all over. After chatting with mom for 5-10 minutes, the pt stated that she felt like her symptoms were not worsening and were stabilizing. The pt then said she wanted to rest at home. I recommended she sit for a little longer, but mom stated she would keep a close eye on the pt and had an epipen at home. They then left the pharmacy. I followed up with mom on May 30th at approximately 4:00 PM to see how the pt was doing, and she stated that they were at the ER because the symptoms were not getting any better, and the pt "felt like she was having an asthma attack." Pt's mom states that the pt is doing much better after receiving IV meds.
14 2021-05-29 fall patient was given pfizer vaccine and was sitting in the chair for post vaccination waiting for about... Read more
Close
patient was given pfizer vaccine and was sitting in the chair for post vaccination waiting for about 5 minutes. Suddenly I looked up, I noticed her body stiffened and her eyes closed. she tumbled to the floor and hit her head on the ground. Paramedics were dispatched immediately. patient woke up right away, we checked her pulse, forehead for fever, and back of her head for any possible bleeding. She answered all questions that we asked of her correctly (such as her name, her age, etc.) Paramedics arrived, took her blood pressure, oxygen level (both normal), blood sugar (normal). Parents decided to take her to hospital for further evaluation. I called and spoke to Dad 5 hours later, dad stated that she is doing fine.

14 2021-06-01 dizziness HPI: Patient is a * year old * who presents following administration of the first dose of Pfizer COV... Read more
Close
HPI: Patient is a * year old * who presents following administration of the first dose of Pfizer COVID19 vaccine in the left deltoid. She states that immediately following administration of the vaccine, she started to feel lightheaded with ?fuzzy vision,? and pain with swallowing. She denies a history of anaphylaxis. She affirms seasonal allergies and confirms that she was feeling ?stuffy? this morning. She affirms that she ate and drank this morning without odynophagia. She relates that there was a big family argument that is causing her to feel stressed at this time as well. She affirms pleuritic chest pain, odynophagia, epigastric abdominal pain, headache, lightheadedness, and blurry vision. She denies chest pain, difficulty breathing, swelling of the face/lips/tongue/throat, skin rash/itching, cramping abdominal pain, nausea, and vomiting. Exam: GEN: Alert and oriented x 4, NAD. Patient appears to have a developmental delay secondary to eye contact avoidance, slow to respond, and speech impediment. HEAD: NCAT EYES: PERRL, EOMI ENT: Ears normal, Nose normal, OP normal, no evidence of angioedema NECK: Supple, without LAD. CV: RRR, no m/r/g PULM: Shallow, guarded breathing at rest, but clear to auscultation bilaterally with deep inspiration, no accessory muscle use ABD: Soft, no tenderness. SKIN: No rashes, skin warm and dry. No erythema or edema of the injection site. MSK: FROM, MS 5/5 NEURO: Alert and oriented x 4, CN 2-12 grossly intact, no ataxia, gait steady Clinical Impression/Field Tx: Vital signs stable and physical exam within normal limits, however, patient continued to report odynophagia, pleuritic chest pain, abdominal pain, lightheadedness, and blurry vision, even after giving patient snack/drink and reclining her with lower extremities above the level of heart and head. EMS called to the scene for further evaluation. Instructed patient and parent to consult their PCP regarding the post-vaccination reaction. Patient and parent instructed to go to emergency department should she develop chest pain, difficulty breathing, swelling of the face/lips/mouth/tongue/throat, or cramping abdominal pain with nausea/vomiting. Patient and parent demonstrated understanding of post-vaccination instructions. Medications administered: None Disposition: EMS contacted due to patient not improving. Care transferred to EMS . No workup was performed by EMS and they instructed the parent of the patient to take the patient to ER via private car for further evaluation. Father was amenable to plan and signed form.
14 2021-06-01 dizziness Patient felt dizzy immediately after the shot was given. She said she was going to pass out, and di... Read more
Close
Patient felt dizzy immediately after the shot was given. She said she was going to pass out, and did for about 10 seconds. She was sitting up in a chair during this time, with her mom holding her up. She came to, the about 20 seconds later, she passed out again for another 10 seconds. She came to, and was given some water to drink, but 20 seconds after that she threw up the water. I took her blood pressure, and it was 60/40, with a pulse of 60. She was very pale. After resting in the chair and taking deep breaths, her color returned and she felt much better. she also said her vision wasn't blurry anymore. Ten minutes later, she left with her mom, feeling ok. She was very anxious about getting the shot, and told me she had passed out in the pass after giving blood.

Patient came in with her father to get 2nd Pfizer vaccine. Patient stated with the first shot, she felt a little dizzy but then it went away. Her father said she was nervous/anxious to get this vaccine. Patient got the vaccine first, then sat in the observation chair while her father got his vaccine. While her father got the vaccine, I checked on her and she said she felt a little dizzy. Patient agreed to put paper towel on back of neck and wrists. As soon as her father finished his vaccine, we moved her to the immunization room to monitor her (such as blood pressure - readings given to paramedics.) Her heart rate was a little high (I believe 107), then went back to normal. However then her blood pressure started getting lower (around 80/40s) and began feeling worse. Laid patient down with feet elevated and called 911. By the time ambulance arrived, her blood pressure was starting to improve. Her father agreed with ambulance to bring her in to get checked out.

14 2021-06-08 dizziness Patient received 0.3ml Pfizer Covid vaccine injection into the right deltoid. About 10 seconds after... Read more
Close
Patient received 0.3ml Pfizer Covid vaccine injection into the right deltoid. About 10 seconds after receiving the injection, she stood up and started to feel dizzy. About 5 seconds later, patient fainted. Patient was caught by pharmacy staff and was lowered to the ground. After about 10 seconds, patient regained consciousness and was aware of the surroundings. Patient was able to answer questions regarding her name, her location. Pharmacy staff called 911 when patient fainted and paramedic staff came within 8 minutes. Patient was accessed by paramedic staff and was transported to hospital per request of her mother. The vital signs reported by paramedic was as followed: Blood pressure 96/52 , Heart Rate 98.

14 2021-06-09 dizziness My daughter was receiving her second vaccine about 1230pm and while administered she immediately to... Read more
Close
My daughter was receiving her second vaccine about 1230pm and while administered she immediately told me she felt ?dizzy and nauseous.? We sit down, she is not feeling better and within 3 minutes or so she said she felt? dizzy and feel like I?m going to throw up.? She then starts nodding off and on, not able to keep her eyes open. I waved over for help and by the time volunteers got to her she went limo and passes out. She was taken by wheelchair to medic room and they had her lay down. She came alert and said ?everything went black? and had no memory/recollection or awareness of where she was and how she got to the medic room. We gave her water and I asked for crackers and she felt better and was able to leave around 115pm. In addition, we saw a teenage male pass out prior to my daughter and was also taken by wheelchair. I spoke with a RN as I was leaving and was told multiple teens had had the same initial reaction today. She had no reactions or side effects with her first dose.

Close
EOA called in to report an adverse event. Attendee, DOB 05/28/2007. W/in 60 secs of receiving shot, she looked pale, felt dizzy, reported feeling lightheaded. Mom was there and reported this happens when she receives injections. Didn't have time to get her to observation, so laid her down over 3 chairs w/head in mom's lap. First vitals:3:15p, BP 110/70, HR 86, resp 19, O2 100% room air, temp 98F. Kept an eye on her, w/in time she took vitals she was feeling better. 2nd vitals 3:20p, BP 102/70, HR 71, resp 16, O298% room air, temp 98.3. 1st dose of Pfizer, lot EW0217. Shot in L arm. Patient's sx subsided, she was released w/her mother, no further issues.

After I read out the signs of severe allergic reaction. Caller mentioned her daughter had some but not all of them; her lips turned blue; light headache; incoherent; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient's father) reported for his daughter via medical information team. A 14-year-old female patient BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Formulation: Solution for injection, Lot Number, and expiration date: Unknown), via an unspecified route of administration on an unknown date (at the age of 14-year-old) as 1st dose, single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. She received the first dose of the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine three weeks ago and was due to receive the second dose next day. She had a severe reaction to the first dose. she had the first COVID-19 vaccine dose, she had a pretty severe reaction to it, that passed after 15, 20 minutes but just want to make sure that still get the second shot which was scheduled for tomorrow. Reporter stated, patient got her first shot for the first fifteen minutes, her lips turned blue, she got really light headache, become slightly incoherent, then after about 15, 30 minutes those symptoms went away, and she was ok. Reporter wants to know whether she could get her second dose and asked what the signs of a severe allergic reaction are. Consumer read out the signs of severe allergic reaction and mentioned her daughter had some but not all of them. Reporter did not specify any seriousness. The outcome of the events was resolved. Information about batch/lot number has been requested.

14 2021-06-11 dizziness, fall Patient received vaccine at 3:17pm, following which they were instructed to have a seat in the waiti... Read more
Close
Patient received vaccine at 3:17pm, following which they were instructed to have a seat in the waiting area. At 3:21pm, mother reports patient stating they were not feeling well, head tilted to the left and they slipped out from chair onto the floor, resulting in minor trauma to the mouth area. Pharmacy staff responded quickly, calling EMS, instructing patient to stay on floor in recovery position while help arrived. Patient was responsive and alert to questions during this time, mother was blotting mouth area with gauze and water. Patient quickly stabilized after. EMS arrived at 3:37pm and performed follow up tests including HR and blood glucose in EMS vehicle to which mother states results were normal, but patient was again light headed due to sight of blood. Mother and patient declined ride to additional medical facility.
14 2021-06-11 dizziness Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine EUA: Patient was given the vaccination and then walked out to the p... Read more
Close
Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine EUA: Patient was given the vaccination and then walked out to the pharmacy waiting area. She sat down, told her mom that she felt dizzy and then her head fell backwards while she was sitting in the chair. A moment later, she picked her head up and called for her mom. Pharmacy personnel immediately went out to see what was happening. Mom said to call 911 so the pharmacy technician called 911 and sat with the patient until EMS arrived. Patient was talking and still sitting in her chair when EMS arrived and she was taken by EMS to the hospital. We contacted her father by cell phone a couple of hours later and he said that she was having tests done.

Patient was getting tingly, lightheaded, pale, and eyes rolling back after receiving her first dose of the Pfizer Covid vaccine. We gave her some glucose tablets and she seemed to get better afterwards. I did a pulse oximeter on her her and her pulse and oxygen was normal. I offered mother if she wanted me to call 911 and she said no. I counseled mother and the girl to monitor how she is feeling and to seek 911 or urgent care if she gets worst throughout the day. The girl left the store feeling okay.

Close
Prior to vaccination patient appeared anxious and resulted in nose bleed. During observation period time vitals assessed. Pt reports needle anxiety; spoke clearly without difficulty; A&O x3. Vitals: BP: 90/60; HR 70; O2 Sat: 98% in room air; RR: 20. LPN educated in slow deep breath techniques, provided water, and educated to keep car cool. Vitals re-checked at 1429: BP: 112/80; HR: 70; O2 Sat: 98% on room air; RR:20; pt reports feeling "dizzy" and stated she did not eat prior to vaccine. LPN provided OJ and crackers; continued to monitor for 25 full minutes. Pt reports "feeling better" after interventions; vitals within range; spoke clearly without difficulty; pt and family educated on high alert symptoms as well as continuing deep breathing and avoiding the sun. Pt left at 1435.

Close
The patient received her first dose of the covid vaccine and was fine immediately after the shot but after she got up and walked out of the consultation room she fell over and fainted. We cleared the area and put ice packs on her forehead and behind her neck and put some fragrance in front of her to smell which woke her up. Once she woke up her dad lifted her back into the consultation room and we had her lay down and put her feet on a chair. She was lying down for about 10 minutes then we gave her gatorade and she said she felt better. Once she got up, I asked her to remain seated in our waiting for another 15 minutes before leaving.

14 2021-06-16 fall HPI: 14-year-old female 1 minute post-vaccination developed 1 syncopal episode, lasting 5 seconds. P... Read more
Close
HPI: 14-year-old female 1 minute post-vaccination developed 1 syncopal episode, lasting 5 seconds. Patient was caught by her father prior to falling off her seat and regained consciousness. She was able to verbally communicate and respond to commands. No falls or head trauma witnessed. Patient reported a similar episode with her first dose of Pfizer; she was seen at her PCP the following day and was told she could get her second dose. Patient denied shortness of breath, pruritus, difficulty breathing, fatigue, diaphoresis, tongue or lip swelling. Patient was fully assessed by medical staff and given PO fluids and cold compress. She was monitored for 30 minutes with no further progression of symptoms. Upon leaving the patient reported a full recovery of any adverse symptoms and was driven home by her father. Patient and parent were educated to call for EMS if symptoms returned and to follow-up with her PCP. Physical Assessment: BP: 96/60 mmHg left arm, sitting position HR: 79 bpm RR: 18 breaths per minute SpO2: 97% RA Constitutional: No acute distress. Non-diaphoretic. Lungs: Clear to auscultation bilaterally. Heart: Regular rate & rhythm. No murmurs, rubs, or gallops. Neurology: A&O x3. Normal speech and gait. Skin: Warm and dry.

14 2021-06-17 fall Fallen unconscious and collapsed; Fell down and she was not conscious/passed out; Had concussion lik... Read more
Close
Fallen unconscious and collapsed; Fell down and she was not conscious/passed out; Had concussion like falling on the ground but it appears like a seizure, that was a immediate thing; Fallen unconscious and collapsed; Fell down and she was not conscious; Had concussion like falling on the ground but it appears like a seizure, that was a immediate thing; Low blood pressure; Fever; Shaking/She was shaking/still moving; She was not feeling well; She is still twitching; Eyes go back; This is a spontaneous report from a Pfizer-sponsored program. A contactable consumer (mother) reported that a 14-years-old female patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), dose 2 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 03Jun2021 (Batch/Lot number was reported as EW 'O or 0' 186) at the age of 14-years-old as SINGLE DOSE for covid-19 immunisation. The patient medical history was none. There were no concomitant medications. No family medical history of seizure. The patient previously received the first dose of BNT162B2 on an unknown date at Arm Left for covid-19 immunisation. The reason for the transfer today (03Jun2021) was that her 14 year old daughter immediately after getting her second dose of the COVID vaccine started shaking, experiencing fever and fallen unconscious and collapsed and was taken to the hospital and she wanted to go ahead and report those adverse side effects for her. She (patient) was 14 year old and she got her second vaccination today and few minutes after she got it, she stood up and she said she was not feeling well and then the next thing reporter knew like her eyes go back, she do not seem conscious and she was shaking as if, looks like she was having a seizure and then she fell down and she was not conscious, so she fell down, she is still twitching. She has no history of like seizures but that is like twisting and now she was taken to the hospital. So, the hospital treated her as if she had a concussion. Reporter have reported to them that she looks like it was a seizure before she fell down, into her head. Reporter further stated "That day was her second shot and like I said she stood up, she got up from that, she said that she got funny and that I can see where she just kind of lost consciousness, eyes going back, shaking as if she was having seizures and then she fell down and she was unconscious and she is like still moving as if she is having a seizure and she was taken. Reporter stated, "it was a like a seizure but it is like over and she had concussion like falling on the ground but it appears like a seizure, that was a immediate thing." For treatment, reporter stated that "Any treatment, No. She was taken to the hospital and the hospital needs to write it down and I don't understand that, the hospital wrote down concussion but the hospital they took the vital signs and she had low blood pressure." For the date when patient went to the hospital, reporter stated "That was today, June 3rd and she is discharged. The reason she was taken was potential seizure and it was concussion and it was after she fell, she passed out and had low blood pressure. The outcome of the events was unknown. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.

14 2021-06-20 dizziness Approximately 10 minutes after patient had received her 1st COVID-19 Vaccine she states she started ... Read more
Close
Approximately 10 minutes after patient had received her 1st COVID-19 Vaccine she states she started to see spots and was feeling weak/dizzy and she proceeded to pass out. Family members and Pharmacist guided patient into a chair where she did not respond to verbal commands, patient was breathing normally and eyes remained open. Patient came to after approximately 10 seconds and was shaken up/scared, but overall feeling ok. Patient stayed in facility and saw provider, noted that BP was low at 88/40mmHg. Patient also had blood sugar checked which was 101 and BP was rechecked and was 90/50mmHg. Patient reported she had not ate all day and was nervous about receiving a shot. Provider determined that patient had returned to baseline and she was ok to go home.

14 2021-06-21 dizziness Patient is a 14 yo girl with PMH significant for migraines who presented with one day of chest pain ... Read more
Close
Patient is a 14 yo girl with PMH significant for migraines who presented with one day of chest pain and nausea that woke her from sleep in the setting of multiple days of malaise. She states that after receiving the COVID-19 vaccine three days prior to admission she has not been feeling well. She reports subjective fevers and chills the day after receiving the vaccine, and intermittent feelings of her heart racing. She also has been feeling hot and generally unwell. + shortness of breath. The night of admission, she awoke from sleep with burning central anterior chest pain and nausea. She tried to stand up and felt generally weak, and then had tunnel vision and felt she was going to faint. Per mom, she was pale and diaphoretic at that time. The pre-syncopal symptoms resolved within about 10 minutes and the chest pain persisted for approx one hour. Parents called EMS and she was brought to the ED for evaluation. Of note, she reports a history of pre-syncopal sx however has never lost consciousness before. Also reports a history of intermittent palpitations. No hx chest pain prior to this episode. + fevers/chills as mentioned after receiving COVID vaccine three days PTA but no infectious sx prior to that. No cough/URI sx, no abdominal pain, no nausea. + diarrhea night of admission. No sick contacts. She is active in dance and has good exercise tolerance for that; does not spend much time outdoors. No known insect or tick bites. + FHx of sister with heart murmur as a baby that spontaneously resolved; unclear diagnosis. In the ED BP 94/62, T 97.4, P 84, R 16, SpO2 100% on RA EKG: sinus rhythm, no ST or PR changes CMP: unremarkable CBC: WBC 11.8, Hgb 11.5 Trop T 0.33 Bedside echo w/ reported good function UA wnl COVID neg CXR PA and lat unremarkable On arrival to the PCICU she reported feeling at her baseline and denied chest pain and shortness of breath.

14 2021-06-24 dizziness, fall Patient received vaccine. As she walked out of the consult room she felt dizzy and described that sh... Read more
Close
Patient received vaccine. As she walked out of the consult room she felt dizzy and described that she thought she blacked out. She fell into a plastic room divider and went to the ground. Her dad was right there and hoisted her upright. Offered to call ambulance but patient's dad declined and reported that she had history of being squeamish and had passed out from needles before. Patient was breathing and quickly began responding verbally. Her dad picked her up and she sat upright in a chair. Took patient's blood pressure, provided water, and had patient sit. First blood pressure reading was low (90s over 40s). Offered to call ambulance again. Patient's dad declined. Patient drank water and juice. Retested blood pressure about 15-20 minutes later and it was 116/65 and patient reported that dizziness had subsided. Patient's dad had left message with doctor's office to report what had happened and to see if they wanted her to come in to be seen today. Encouraged him to do that and seek medical attention if anything worsened.
14 2021-06-24 dizziness Site: Pain at Injection Site-Mild, Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Severe, Systemic: Fainting / ... Read more
Close
Site: Pain at Injection Site-Mild, Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Severe, Systemic: Fainting / Unresponsive-Medium, Systemic: Flushed / Sweating-Medium, Systemic: Hypotension-Medium, Systemic: Vomiting-Severe, Systemic: Weakness-Severe
14 2021-06-24 fall Within 2 hours of the vaccine, patient was experiencing nausea and general feeling of unwellness. Wi... Read more
Close
Within 2 hours of the vaccine, patient was experiencing nausea and general feeling of unwellness. Within 3 hours, patient had a fever of 99.9. At 11 pm, patient had a fever of 100. Mother administered Tylenol and patient went to bed. Patient woke up around 4:30 am with her whole body shaking uncontrollably. Mother heard her stirring and went to check on her. Her temperature was 100. Mother sat and talked with her and offered a snack, drink, and more Tylenol. Mother checked her pulse, which was normal. Patient was coherent and able to communicate. Mother left the room to get snack and drink and heard something fall over in patient's room and Mother called out and waited a few seconds for a response. Patient did not respond. Mother went back in the room, as it was unusual for patient not to respond, and found patient sitting back up and placing her head in her hands, stating in a panicked voice that she felt she was going to throw up and that she was very hot and that her head hurt really bad. Patient stated that her ears felt weird and everything went black and she somehow fell over from a sitting position on her bed to laying on her bed and had landed on the dog. Patient was unaware that she had knocked over her water bottle and had no recollection of the loud sound it made as it fell over (unusual because loud sounds are very startling for her). The shaking subsided to a tremor a few minutes after the black out. Patient then reported feeling very cold and her temperature had risen to 101. Patient complained of an extreme headache and continued nausea. Mother took patient to Urgent Care, who performed bloodwork and an EKG, and then referred patient to the Emergency Room for an EEG. ER repeated EKG and declined to do EEG and told patient to follow up with her doctor in 5 - 7 days.

Paramaedics came and evaluated her. She was feeling better about 20 minutes later so mom took her home.

Close

She stated she had only had a muffin for breakfast. Staff provided juice, water and nutri-grain bar. Due to nausea, only able to drink a small amount of juice. Moved client to cot. EMS was called. Provided cold compress for forehead. She continued to drink the juice. Pulse ox was taken and was 98 continuously while she was on the cot. Nursing staff evaluated her for symptoms and improvement. She state she was still dizzy, lightheaded, and nauseous. She also stated her throat hurt/felt tight. EMS arrived. Interpreter used during event.

14 2021-07-07 fall Patient was given vaccine seated, patient fell out of chair onto the floor less than 1-2 minutes aft... Read more
Close
Patient was given vaccine seated, patient fell out of chair onto the floor less than 1-2 minutes after vaccine. Possible vasovagal response. Patient has history of vasovagal response to vaccines and had doctors order to get this vaccine. Patient was not unconscious that we are aware of. Had patient lay down on her side for at least 5 minutes until she felt comfortable to sit up (on floor). Patient was alert, was given water, blood pressure was measured 10 minutes later at 117/81, temperature was within normal limits. Emergency services were not necessary and patient/parent declined. Monitored patient for over 30 minutes and they elected to go home after as she was feeling better. Called parent today at 8pm and patient is said to be feeling much better and no issues since.
14 2021-07-08 dizziness After vaccination, patient stood up and walked around the room. She started bouncing and acting a li... Read more
Close
After vaccination, patient stood up and walked around the room. She started bouncing and acting a little nervous. I asked if she was feeling light headed woozy, she said a little bit. I sat her back in the chair. After about 30 seconds she fell sideways to the arm of the chair then slouched forward. I caught her before she went all the way to the floor and leaned her back into the chair, she then seized for approximately 3-5 seconds. Grandpa (legal guardian) was in the room and helped me get her to the floor where she came out for a few seconds and opened her eyes for 5-10 seconds passed out again then seized again for 3-5 seconds. She then woke up on the floor and was alert and looking around. She was very pale, I elevated her feet for a while and had her lay on the floor for 7-10 minutes. I then had her sit up on the floor and provided a bottle of water and put cold compress on the back of her neck. She stayed seated on the floor for about 5-7 minutes before I had her move to the chair to sit again with back against the back of the chair. She continued to sit there sipping water and talking for 7 minutes or so. Learned at this point that patient had not eaten breakfast and has passed out after a vaccination in the past (had not marked on the intake form). After 7 minutes or so, had the patient try to stand. She said her legs were wobbly, so I had her sit back down for several more minutes. Her coloring was much better at this point. After another several minutes we tried standing again and she felt better at that point. Had her just stand in the room for about 3 minutes before walking to the waiting room. Had her then sit in the waiting room for 5 minutes then she walked out with grandpa. They were going to get breakfast. Grandpa was going to call MD to discuss the events and follow up as necessary as well as to discuss plan going forward concerning the second dose.

Close
Client received her 2nd dose Pfizer COVID vaccine this afternoon at our offsite clinic by a LPN. Had just asked for a bandaid because there was a spot of blood where she had received the vaccine. Her sister reports she said she was feeling dizzy then her sister turned away and the client fell from standing position to the ground at 1412. Hit on her right side, shoulder and face. Lost conscious momentarily and together with family members we rolled her onto her back. I directed co-worker to call 911. Client came to and we helped her to sit up against the wall. Blood pressure 96/52, P 80 at 1415. Family and client denied history of seizures or fainting. Weather outside hot and client reported she hadn't eaten anything all day. Water provided. Client reported pain from the right side of her face and her lower lip which had a laceration from the fall that was bleeding a small amount. Fire EMS arrived just after 1420. Reported their vitals as BP 110/68, P 97, O2 99%. Ambulance arrived around 1430 and assessed. They had her rise from sitting to standing and reported her SBP dropped to the 70s. Paramedics advised to be assessed in ER. Client left in ambulance at 1443 accompanied by mother. Family provided reassurance regarding syncopal episode and contributing factors. They had no further questions or concerns at time of departure.

15 y/o F with no known prior medical conditions or NKDA presented for her first dose of Pfizer vaccine. 5-min post vaccination the patient began to feel dizzy and light-headed. The patient experienced a syncopal event resulting in an assisted fall from chair. The fall was atraumatic and the patient instantly regained consciousness. Patient was alert and oriented x3, and rapidly improved back to her baseline. Patient denied any SOB, difficulty breathing, throat swelling, itching, or HA. Parental guardian was advised to keep patient hydrated and educated on any signs or symptoms that would warrant urgent care.

Approximately 10 minutes after receiving her first Pfizer dose IM, Patient was experiencing a headache rated 4/10 on the pain scale as well as light headedness. Patients vehicle was directed to the ambulance on standby, paramedic crew assessed the patient. Vitals were stable and since the patient was a minor, the patient mother made a decision to refuse transport and exited the facility without issue. End of report.

Systemic: Chills-Medium, Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Severe, Systemic: Fainting / Unresponsive-Medium, Systemic: Nausea-Medium, Systemic: Numbness (specify: facial area, extremities)-Medium, Systemic: Shakiness-Medium
15 2021-05-15 dizziness Pt was brought in by her father for her first dose of Pfizer vaccine. Prior to receiving the vaccine... Read more
Close
Pt was brought in by her father for her first dose of Pfizer vaccine. Prior to receiving the vaccine, her father asked her to let the writer know of her fear of needle and what occurs when she she has blood draws or vaccination. Patient states that she usually lays down because she feels faint and passes out at times. After she sat down, another chair was provided to rest her legs. Pfizer dose was administered and within a minute, she acknowledged that she about to passed out. She had a near syncopal episode with both arms contracting. She was carried from the chair to the floor. Her father, who was prepared for this, had ammonia with him and had the patient sniff it and she responded to it. She was observed for little over 30 minutes and walked out of the pharmacy stating that she felt well. Throughout the ordeal, she was responding appropriately.
15 2021-05-15 fall Patient received her first dose of the Pfizer COVID19 vaccine at approximately 12pm. Patient felt fi... Read more
Close
Patient received her first dose of the Pfizer COVID19 vaccine at approximately 12pm. Patient felt fine immediately after the vaccination and was instructed to sit and wait for 15 minutes. The immunizer, watched the patient sit down in a chair. A few minutes later the mother of that patient began screaming help, help. Patient had fainted, falling on the floor and hitting her head. I ran our to assist patient, I instructed my technicians to call 911. Patient was on the floor, shaking. I assisted her in rolling over. When she came to I helped her control her breathing and take deep breaths. I used I gauze pad to stop the bleeding on her head. I made sure she was lying flat on the floor. We gave her an ice pack to help with the numbness and tingling in her hands. The paramedics arrived and took patient to the hospital.

Close
AFTER COVID19 VACCINATION, PATIENT EXPRIENCED DIZZINESS, WEAKNESS WITH DIFFICULTY MAINTAINING EYE CONTACT. PATIENT STATED SHE FELT SLEEPY WITH DIFFICULTY KEEPING EYES OPEN. AFTER 25 MINUTES, PATIENT WAS AAOX4, VITALS WNL, AMBULATING WITHOUT ASSISTANCE AND LEFT CLINIC WITH FATHER, DENYING ANY DIZZINESS OR WEAKNESS. VITALS: BP HR RR SPO2 12:45 138/80 100 16 99% 12:53 150/90 85 16 99% 12:58 138/90 81 14 99% 13:02 128/80 80 14 99% 13:07 122/86 75 16 99%
15 2021-05-16 dizziness She got her vaccine, she was sitting in the chair and 4-5 minutes after the shot she started telling... Read more
Close
She got her vaccine, she was sitting in the chair and 4-5 minutes after the shot she started telling her grandfather that she felt nauseated. She then started feeling dizzy and looked like she was going to pass out and he caught her and he laid on her on the floor on a pillow. There was a off-duty paramedic to assist her and they suggested to call 9-1-1 and they showed up 5-6 minutes later. She was then taken to Hospital. They ran a lot of laboratory tests, urinalysis and everything was negative. Her white blood cell count was high and her URC's and UBC's were high. Her albumin was also high. She was then released from the ER and was told to FU with PCP within 2 days. She is still having the symptoms of headache, sore throat, and achy bones, the typical flu-like side effects. She is taking Tylenol for the symptoms, as well as cough drops for her throat.
15 2021-05-16 dizziness Patient began to feel lightheaded, experienced blurred vision, clammy skin, eyes dilated, 10 minutes... Read more
Close
Patient began to feel lightheaded, experienced blurred vision, clammy skin, eyes dilated, 10 minutes following IM dose of Pfizer vaccine, about 2pm. Dose was administered at 1:45pm Mother asked pharmacist to call 911 because her daughter was feeling dizzy. Medical first responders arrived at 2:08pm, took her blood pressure, O2, and blood sugar, temperature. All were within normal ranges. O2=100, BP 114/60mmHg . Even though all vitals were normal, first responders recommended patient should follow up with primary care provider. First responders told mother response was likely due to nervousness or anxiety about new vaccine.

Close
client felt lightheaded after receiving 1st Pfizer Covid Vaccine. Client received vaccine at 1717 and RN kept client in chair a few mins as client stated feeling nervous. PHN brought client water. Per client had only ate snack prior to appointment. Client able to transfer by herself to anti gravity chair. 1722 vitals: blood pressure 122/68, oxygen 98%, pulse 81. Per client feeling nausea, RN gave emesis bag. Client appeared diaphoretic and pale. Per Mother only medical history is seasonal allergies and client takes Zyrtec as needed. No history of fainting with vaccines in the past or allergies. Vitals at 1728: blood pressure 118/72, pulse 82, oxygen 97%. Per client symptoms still there, but improving. Vitals at 1733: blood pressure 120/70, pulse 83, oxygen 100%. Client stated lightheaded resolved, nausea still same. Client denied blurry vision, headache, warmth feeling. Vitals at 1738: blood pressure 118/72, pulse 80, oxygen 99%. Per client all symptoms resolved. Last vitals at 1743: blood pressure 114/80, pulse 76, oxygen 99%. Mother driving client home. Advised to follow up with provider and ER precautions given. After completing 30 min observation client left facility with steady gait at 1750.

15 2021-05-16 fall, vertigo After administration of vaccine the patient stood up quickly and passed out. The patient fell down ... Read more
Close
After administration of vaccine the patient stood up quickly and passed out. The patient fell down and came to rather quickly. After she came to we helped her to a chair and sat her down, advised her to put her head between her knees, and got her some water that she requested. After a few minutes she appeared rather pale and went to ask her if she was ok and she asked for a trash can because she felt like she was going to be sick. We gave her a garbage bag and she did get sick in the garbage bag. We kept an eye on her for another 15-20 minutes and she stated that she felt better and that she thought she was ok to leave. We offered her help to her car but she denied it saying she would be ok with she walked slowly. Her father was with her the entire time. While talking with them the father did state that she had incidents like that in the past where she stood up too fast and got light headed and passed out.

As she sat back down she vomited and then seemed to get better after. 911 was called and she was better by the time they arrived and blood pressure and vitals where all good.

15 2021-05-17 dizziness 15 year old female found in supine position with feet elevated in vaccination area. Pt had a left u... Read more
Close
15 year old female found in supine position with feet elevated in vaccination area. Pt had a left upper lip injury (non-bleeding) , redness and slight swelling to left lateral eye area. She also had a less than dime sized abrasion to right knee. Pt was recovered from dizziness (syncope) and then placed into a wheelchair and placed onto a cot in the observation area with her feet elevated with a chair. VS 107/73 66 24 and an O2 sat of 99% on RA Pt timid and somewhat afraid of passing out again. Chair was later removed and then pt sat up in bed with apprehension. She ate a bag of doritos and drank a half bottle of water ( about 250 ml) She then stood up and denied any dizziness but insisted on sitting and/or lying down. She did sit back down for another 10 minutes and later stood up , denies any symptoms. Pt then ambulated to BR without help, MAEW, NAD, steady gait. She was a + o x 3, VS at 1431 111/69 74 22 with O2 sat of 99% on RA. Pt and mother given directions to change positions slowly allowing 30-60 seconds per position change. They both acknowledged this. Pt discharged home with sister and mother with direction to f/u with pcp as needed and to increase sodium and water intake today and tomorrow. No medical history Denies taking any medications Denies any allergies (name), site supervisor aware of situation. Vaccination Site

Pt was very anxious before shot given. Mother had to physically hold pt down for her to receive the shot. Afterwards, pt reported headache, dizziness, and sore throat immediately after the shot. Pt was hyperventilating so I encouraged deep breathing and hydration. HEENT and Pulm exam were normal, as were the vitals. Pt eventually recovered without any other intervention. Pt waited for full 30 minutes after dose.

Close
Pt received vaccine with mother present at 1419, c/o dizziness, lightheadedness, blurry vision, difficulty hearing, at 1439. Pt states she did not eat lunch. Nursing team intervened by taking vitals, placing wet towel on forehead, lying pt in supine position with legs elevated. Pt VS stable, pulse in 80s, BP(120s/80s), 99% on RA, RR 16-18, no respiratory distress, no s/sx anaphylaxis. Pt states she did not eat lunch. Gatorade offered to pt. Dizziness improves in supine position but returns upon sitting. At 1532 pt states she has facial numbness. EMS called at 1535. EMS arrived at 1557 and assessed pt. Pt?s BG is 93, VS stable. Pt reports feeling dazed, unable to focus, blurry vision and difficulty hearing. At 1602 EMS informed pt that they will take her to Medical Center, pt immediately got agitated and started crying and hyperventilating. 1604 pt stated she had difficulty breathing and a light localized rash began to appear on her chest. 1605 EMS transported pt. Pt?s mother to follow.

15 2021-05-18 dizziness At 114, patient reported feeling light headed to EMT. EMT assessed patient vitals: blood pressure (... Read more
Close
At 114, patient reported feeling light headed to EMT. EMT assessed patient vitals: blood pressure (unable to obtain blood pressure), SpO2 94%, and pulse 54 beats/minute. Patient given water and rested head on mother's shoulder. Patient reported no difficulty breathing/itchiness/hives/rashes. Patient reported history of eosinophilic esophagitis. Patient reassessed at 1120. Patient vitals were blood pressure (unable to obtain), SpO2 96% and pulse 96 beats/minute. Patient reassessed at 1140. Patient vitals were blood pressure 96/80 mmHg, SpO2 100% and pulse 90 beats/minute. Patient stated she felt a lot better. Lead nurse educated patient on following up with primary care provider, signing up on v-safe, and signs/symptoms of when to seek emergency care.

15 2021-05-18 dizziness First symptom was dizziness and nausea. Then, immediately began sweating profusely . Then began seei... Read more
Close
First symptom was dizziness and nausea. Then, immediately began sweating profusely . Then began seeing spots that distorted her vision. Immediate pain in the ears, which felt as is the ears were very swollen and inflamed. It was difficult to talk because talking caused pain in the ears. Severe headache. Obviously her anxiety level escalated. We immediately found wet paper towels to place on her forehead and back of the neck to cool her. I found a hair tie and tied her hair up off her neck to keep her as cool as possible. She was sweating so much she soaked her t-shirt and was pouring sweat down her face, neck and body. We also moved patient from the chair, and placed her on the floor of the pharmacy, leaning against the wall with her legs stretched out. As a type 1 diabetic, the obvious concern was blood sugar during this reaction. Patient wears an insulin pump and Dexcom continuous glucose monitor. I was able to read her blood sugar levels during all the reaction time. Her blood sugar level spiked up. It then began to drop after a few minutes. I had an apple juice, and gave her the 15 carb apple juice.

15 2021-05-21 fall Patient received vaccine and responded "oh that was easy", got up from the chair, and walked away fr... Read more
Close
Patient received vaccine and responded "oh that was easy", got up from the chair, and walked away from the clinic area then fell to the floor. RPH on duty did not see the first fall. Patient was responsive, talking, and laughing (at times) during the event. RPH on duty asked patient if she was okay while she was still lying on the floor. The patient responded by saying I'm okay. The patient then stood up and proceeded to walk toward the pharmacy lobby but then fell to the floor a second time. The RPH on duty called 911, passed the call over to the pharmacy tech to complete the call, then placed a cold cloth (paper towel ) across the patient's forehead. Emergency Medical Technicians arrived on the scene within minutes. Patient maintained consciousness and was responsive throughout the event. Patient was evaluated by EMT personnel and eventually left the store via wheelchair accompanied by EMT personnel and parent.

Suddenly my vision got super bright and I could hardly see, and then I couldn?t hold myself up and I slowly collapsed onto the ground. It only lasted a few minutes, and then I was perfectly fine. It came on very suddenly and didn?t last long, but it was extreme during those few minutes. It was also very hot that day. And I had a mild migraine headache in the morning, but that wasn?t very bad, and I get migraines fairly regularly.
15 2021-05-23 gait disturbance, inability to stand Day 6 post vaccine patient began complaining of bilateral anterior ankle pain, and L hip pain. She ... Read more
Close
Day 6 post vaccine patient began complaining of bilateral anterior ankle pain, and L hip pain. She had a low grade fever of 99.8 at that time. The following day Day 7, she had general fatigue, bilateral angle pain, and malaise. On Saturday, Day 8 she was unable to stand for periods of 15 minutes or longer due to pain in both ankles, and her knees, and elbows began to hurt. On this day she was given advil 400mg without relief, she then took Tylenol 650mg and the joint pain decreased from a 9 to a 6. We have had to continue alternating tylenol and advil since Saturday and she is unable to stand or walk for prolonged periods.

Close
Pt reported feeling woozy, dizzy, and nauseous after walking out to waiting room after receiving shot. Approximately 3 minutes after shot was given I was called out to the waiting room as the patient had passed out. I helped her mother lower her to the floor and by the time we lowered her down she was regaining consciousness. After about 5 minutes she was feeling better and we moved her into the immunization room to wait for EMS. EMS came and evaluated her and determined she was ok to go home

15 2021-05-25 dizziness Prior to arrival, the patient received her first COVID vaccine at the clinic, after which she sudden... Read more
Close
Prior to arrival, the patient received her first COVID vaccine at the clinic, after which she suddenly felt dizzy, described as lightheadedness, and felt warm. She was noted to be hypotensive with SBP at 67. She subsequently drank water with some improvement. No syncope, severe headache, numbness, tingling sensations, or focal weakness. Mother was concerned and brought the child to the ED for further evaluation. Currently the patient feels better. No similar symptoms in the past. The patient denies any chest pain or pressure, shortness of breath, or abdominal pain. No recent fever or cough.She is otherwise healthy and has a normal cardiopulmonary exam and reassuring EKG. The description of her symptoms and the environment which happened is very consistent with vasovagal syncope and she does not have any stigmata, and acute neurologic or cardiac emergency. I believe she is safe and stable for discharge home and she was discharged with return precautions and follow-up instructions.

About 5 minutes after receiving her vaccine, patient described feeling light headed, had hearing and visual disturbances, felt like she might pass out. after several minutes of sitting with head between her leg, those symptoms went away but she said she had developed a headache. At time she left pharmacy she said she felt ok other than her headache.

15 2021-05-26 dizziness Pt came in to pharmacy with her mom for her 1st dose Pfizer vaccine appointment at 2pm on 5/26/21. W... Read more
Close
Pt came in to pharmacy with her mom for her 1st dose Pfizer vaccine appointment at 2pm on 5/26/21. We checked her in and (pharmacist ) gave her shot with her mom present at 2 10pm and she was fine with no issues. Within 2 minutes in of her observation period, she started fainting and having seizure like for about 10 seconds, and regained conscious and said she felt dizzy and then blacked out. She was pale and sweating and asked for water. Our shift lead happened to be closed by her chair where she was sitting so she prevented pt from falling down from the chair and called pharmacist for help from inside the pharmacy. Pharmacist rushed to the patient and asked shift lead to call 911. Pt was consious, but lethargic, she could breath normally, no sign of obtruction airway. Pharmacist lift her legs up to opposite chair and started to take BP. Paramedic arrived within minutes and took her vitals which was normal. Mom agreed for paramedic took her out in stretcher to hospital for check up.

Close
Moments after the vaccine administration, pt started to experience difficulty breathing, lightheadedness, flushing of the face, swelling of lips. Epinephrine 0.3 mg IM was administered, 911 contacted. A few minutes after the epinephrine administration, pt started to breath better. EMT came in within 5-10 minutes. Checked pt's vitals, administered required care and took the pt to the ER.
15 2021-05-27 fall Patient received vaccine, then proceeded to faint and fall out of chair. She hit her head on the fl... Read more
Close
Patient received vaccine, then proceeded to faint and fall out of chair. She hit her head on the floor. Mom was with her--patient was coherent and speaking to me. She said her head hurt--I told her I'd get an ice pack, which I did and gave to her. Mom was really worried so I asked her if she wanted me to call 911, which I did. 2 EMTs came and checked the patient out. Mom wanted her to go get checked out at the hospital so the patient and Mom went with the EMTs. I called Mom around 8:00pm 5/28/2021 and she said pt was checked out. The hospital doctor said it was a vaso-vagal reaction and released patient home with no restrictions.
