Close
RN vaccinated client and within 30 seconds noticed client started moving to the side. RN held client at chair, RN responded while two other RNs set up anti-gravity chair. Between all nurses, lifted client and laid in chair. PHN joined, client oriented to self and situation, pale, diaphoretic. Vitals at 1412: blood pressure 100/60 pulse 76, oxygen 97%. Client stated feeling dizzy, denied headache, blurry vision, nausea, shortness of breath, chest pain. Client given water and juice. Father present stated no reaction to first vaccine, allergies to peanuts and seafood. Vitals at 1414: blood pressure 106/70, pulse 79, oxygen 98%. Client alert and oriented x4, stated felt dizzy but did not lose consciousness. Per client same thing happened years ago when having blood drawn. Father informed we would observe for 30 mins. 1417: blood pressure 108/72, pulse 81, oxygen 98%. Client stated feeling better. Vitals at 1422: blood pressure 106/74, pulse 79, oxygen 97%. Client stated symptoms resolved. Alert and oriented x4, color normal for ethnicity. Per Father, client's blood pressure is on the lower end. Vitals at 1427: blood pressure 100/70, pulse 85, oxygen 99%. No complaints. Vitals at 1437: blood pressure 100/70, pulse 85, oxygen 98%. Per client feeling fine, everything resolved. Client and Father given ER precautions and advised to follow up with provider. Last vitals before client leaving blood pressure 106/78, pulse 87, oxygen 97%. Client able to stand up with no complaints. Client left facility with steady gait at 1444.44.

15 2021-06-03 dizziness Immediately after the patient received the vaccine, the patient turned pale and said, "I feel a litt... Read more
Close
Immediately after the patient received the vaccine, the patient turned pale and said, "I feel a little dizzy and my vision is blurry." The patient fainted and ended up having a seizure. Once the patient regained consciousness, the patient was nauseated and vomited. Minutes later she had another seizure but immediately came out of it. We asked the patient if this happen to her during the first dose and she said it did not. The patient does not have a history of epilepsy. The patient's mother did say she had the exact same reaction when she had braces put on. The patient sat in the waiting room for 30 minutes while drinking water. Before the patient left, we had check up on her and she said she felt completely fine. I (the pharmacist) called the mother a couple of hours later to check up on the patient. The mother said she felt fine as if nothing ever happened. I did recommend to her that her daughter gets checked up at urgent care today just to be on the safe side. The mother said she has an appointment with her primary care next week.

Close
On 5/30/21, patient woke up around 10.30 am and complained of severe headache in back of head (pain level 8-9/10). She was nauseous, unable to sit and even stand. She was getting rainbow circles in her vision. Rushed her to emergency to UCSF, drs ran various blood tests and brain MRI but everything was normal. It was also found that Bipasha had high BP 149/61. The drs could not make out what happened and they discharged her later on after giving some IV fluids and some pain medicine. On 5/31 and 6/1, at home, patient was seemingly okay. On 6/2, Wednesday, patient developed headache again, same symptoms like on 5/30. We rushed her to Urgent care in Fremont and saw her pediatrician dr and a pediatric neurologist. Her BP was high then also 144/87. No cause could be found why. The pediatric neurologist was suggesting it is possible that some Inflammation could be causing the blood fluctuations. Orthostatic testing resulted in major fluctuations of BP. Both neurologist and neurosurgeon have ruled out hydrocephalus. They are saying heart inflammation could be a cause.

15 2021-06-06 dizziness Patient is a 15 year old female who presents following administration of the second dose of Pfizer C... Read more
Close
Patient is a 15 year old female who presents following administration of the second dose of Pfizer COVID19 vaccine in the left deltoid. Patient states that she developed a tender, pruritic, red rash at the site of the injection about 10 minutes following the administration. She relates that she also developed smaller red rashes on the left distal portion of the arm. She states that this did not happen with her first dose of Pfizer vaccine. She states she also feels slightly dizzy, but relates that she only at a grilled cheese for lunch and minimal water intake. She denies a history of anaphylaxis and denies allergies to medications, foods, other vaccines. She affirms a past medical history of low vitamin D (currently treated with supplemental vitamin D gummies) and low iron (untreated). She further relates that she had her tonsils removed about 1 year ago. She denies chest pain, difficulty breathing, swelling of the face/lips/tongue/throat, skin rash/itching, cramping abdominal pain, nausea, and vomiting. Exam (update as needed): GEN: Alert and oriented x 4, NAD. HEAD: NCAT EYES: PERRL, EOMI ENT: Ears normal, Nose normal, OP normal with exception of no tonsils noted, no evidence of angioedema NECK: Supple, without LAD. CV: RRR, no m/r/g PULM: Clear to auscultation bilaterally, no accessory muscle use ABD: Soft, no tenderness. SKIN: Skin warm and dry. 0.5mm ecchymosis noted 2 cm below the AC joint and in the correct anatomical position for IM injection. Roughly 5cm of erythema and edema of the left deltoid injection site. The area is mildly tender to palpation, but nonfluctuant. Two 0.5cm erythematous macules located on the left forearm that are nonfluctuant and nontender to palpation. MSK: FROM, MS 5/5 NEURO: Alert and oriented x 4, CN 2-12 grossly intact, no ataxia, gait steady Clinical Impression/Field Tx: Vaccine site reaction. Vital signs within normal limits. Physical exam otherwise normal. Gave patient 10mg OTC Zyrtec from her personal supply. About 30 minutes following administration, the vaccine site was significantly less erythematous and edematous. Patient did not develop any other symptoms. Patient felt comfortable leaving the site. Advised patient and parent that patient should take 25mg diphenhydramine PO once, once they arrive at home. Instructed patient to consult the patient?s PCP regarding the post-vaccination reaction. Patient instructed to go to emergency department should she develop chest pain, difficulty breathing, swelling of the face/lips/mouth/tongue/throat, worsening skin rash, or cramping abdominal pain with nausea/vomiting. Patient and parent demonstrated understanding of post-vaccination instructions. Medications administered: Patient self administered 10mg of Zyrtec. Disposition: Home

We took care of her and also called 911. While falling her mother caught her, so she didn't get any injuries. she felt fine after 3-5 min. EMT arrived and took care of her.

15 2021-06-08 fall Patient fainted approximately 5 minutes post-vaccine. Patient remained in vaccination room while oth... Read more
Close
Patient fainted approximately 5 minutes post-vaccine. Patient remained in vaccination room while other family members were vaccinated. Patient was leaning on wall in the corner and fainted after family member was vaccinated. She appeared to have hit part of the door and got a small abrasion on her left shoulder. Patient was breathing fine and was out for approximately one minute. After waking, she was kept on floor and sat up when ready. She was observed for an additional thirty minutes and was given a snack and water. Upon leaving, she confirmed she was feeling okay.

Close
Aproximately 5 minutes after receipt of 2nd dose, patient began feeling hot, and dizzy. Symptoms progressed to gagging, loss of vision and hearing. Patient was placed in the modified tredelenburg postion, vital signs obtained and monitored for roughly 40 minutes. Vital signs were initially low, RN assessed patient had not even prior to vaccine adminsitration. Offered water and energy bar, placed bag of ice on back of neck. Patient did not experience and respiratory distress throughout event. Mother was educated on signs and symptosm to monitor for post vaccine and if any new or worsending symptoms presented to seek care at the emergency room.

Close
The evening of the vaccine Maddison had slightly labored breathing, pins and needles feelings in feet and hands. Fever, body aches. The morning after while taking their temperature, Maddison said she couldn't see anything then fell into my arms. Her pupils quickly dilated, she made gutteral sounds while shaking slightly then lost consciousness. I couldn't see her breathing for about 15 seconds and she was confused when she came to. She couldn't hear, see or speak during the episode. We took her to the emergency room where a chest xray and ekg came back clear.

Patient presented to the observation room with her mother to schedule 2nd appointment and be observed after vaccination. Patient lost consciousness and was caught by the observation staff and lowered into a chair. Staff states patient lost consiousness for approximately 30 seconds. Once patient came to she knew her name, where she was, and the date. She still felt very dizzy. Patient's pulse and O2 saturation were immediately taken showing a pulse of 45 and O2 sat of 100%. Unable to get pulse up, lead of operations called for ER support. Patient was gray in color, very weak, and still complaining of dizziness when ER staff arrived. Unable to walk due to weakness, patient was transferred to cart and taken to ER

Close
Status post vaccination , pt. experienced vasovagal syncope. Pt became dizzy, disoriented, and briefly unresponsive. Using a pulsometer, her HR was determined to be 49BPM with an O2sat of 99%. Patient was attended to and provided water, she became oriented and responsive within a few minutes. The patient was monitored for 30 minutes.

Pt given water and juice. 20mins post vaccination BP 88/44, HR 51, RR 20 -- > 7mins later 101/60, 63, 20. Pt stable and released from the vaccination site after symptoms resolved.

Continued to monitor patient; at 1003, BP 106/70, HR 73, R 16, O2 sat 100%. Patient stated that she was feeling better and was ready to leave. Patient was discharged to mother to go home.

Close
Called to where 16 yr old pt sat in observation area with her father. Pt was alert but pale. According to Pt father Pt lost consciousness for a second in chair. PT states she's afraid of needles but she did not faint from first dose of COVID-19 vaccine. PT states she felt lightheaded but did not mention any other symptom. PT father states PT does not have any medical history.Pt states she only had a very small breakfast and no lunch. Assisted PT lay on yoga mat with legs elevated. First set of vital signs were taken at 1:40: BP 109/74; P 72; Res 18; O2 Sat 100%. Second set of VS taken at 1:50 with BP 104/65, P67; Res 18 and O2 Sat 100%. PT states she felt better; her skin color turned normal. Assisted PT sitting up on the yoga mat for a few minutes then back to her chair. Water and snack provided to PT. However, around 2PM PT felt lightheaded again while in chair, she lay herself down on the ground. At this time she felt periodic nausea. Her VS at 2PM BP 108/64; P67;resp 18. Her skin color was normal. Cold towel was placed on forehead with some comfort. 7-UP given to relieve nausea. PT rested on the ground until 2:30 then went back to her chair. Her symptom finally subsided and she left observation area with her father around 2:45PM.

After patient received vaccine, she walked to the Moderna side to wait for mother to get vaccinated. While waiting for mother, patient started to feel "dizzy." She was assisted to chair by staff. Upon assessment, patient was warm to touch and pale color was noted to face. Patient was alert and oriented. BP 100/74, P58, SpO2 99% on room air, water given and cool compresses applied to neck. Extended monitoring in recovery area done. Patient states, "I feel much better." Patient ambulated from facility, with mother, without any difficulty. No s/sx of distress noted.

15 2021-06-12 dizziness Pt reports she had her first dose of Pfizer Covid vaccine on 5/17/21. The following week she had a v... Read more
Close
Pt reports she had her first dose of Pfizer Covid vaccine on 5/17/21. The following week she had a very heavy period that lasted longer than usual with severe cramps and occasional lightheaded/dizzy spells. After her cycle ended, she continued having brief episodes of dizziness, usually when going from sitting to standing, usually resolved quickly (after a few minutes) with rest. Over the past two weeks, the episodes have become more frequent and intense, and over the past few days episodes also include s/s of seeing spots and having blurred vision with nausea, SOB, and palpitations/tachycardia. Tonight while at lacrosse practice, pt suddenly became dizzy and felt like she might pass out, became diaphoretic and pale.
15 2021-06-12 dizziness My daughter received her second Pfizer vaccinations at 2:15 pm. At 1230 at night she work up with s... Read more
Close
My daughter received her second Pfizer vaccinations at 2:15 pm. At 1230 at night she work up with stabbing chest pain in the center of her chest that lasted three hours. She initially said her felt faint and couldn?t catch her breath as well as initial nausea. Being an advanced healthcare professional, I spent five minutes of asking her questions: did she eat something bad, did she feel like she needed and inhaler, did she need to use the restroom, checked her pulse (100bpm with palpitations), no resolve. We live 5 minutes from hospital where we prefer to go, but my daughter didn?t think she could make the five minute ride there. We went to ER that is around the block from us and it was total chaos. 40 + people in the waiting room to be seen. My daughter was visibly in distress, crying and couldn?t keep still because of the intense chest pain she rated a 10 out of 10. Finally they did a 12 lead EKG. The rolled us to the back of the waiting room. After 15 minutes, I rolled back out to the front desk and no attention to her and her severe chest pain. Finally I announced we were going to hospital. The called back to us? ?Good Luck!? Got pt to hospital and the immediately did EKG, lab work, chest x ray, urinalysis. The chest pain became intermittent then final subsided. The doctors ruled out pneumonia, No PE, EKG WNL, lab work fine. The Doctor stated it was chest wall pain and gave us a NSAID prescription. I talked to my sister who is an nurse works in the vaccination clinics. She said she has had patients who have had bouts of pericarditis and pleurisy after the second shot. That motivated me to google second dose Pfizer reaction in teens. There is a rare side effect of myocarditis in the teen population after the second dose. The publication date was June 4 the day before my daughters reaction. I didn?t thinsk the ER physician was aware of the the possible rare side effect of myocarditis in teens. I was happy with the care we did receive.
15 2021-06-12 fall Approximately 30 seconds after injection of covid vaccine patient stopped talking, her eyes rolled b... Read more
Close
Approximately 30 seconds after injection of covid vaccine patient stopped talking, her eyes rolled back and she slumped over in chair. Patients head rolled side to side and patients mom started freaking out thinking she was having a seizure. She screamed at the technician who administered the vaccine to call 911 . Patient regained consciousness after 10 seconds and was fully alert and able to speak/ answer questions. Pt maintained consciousness the whole time while waiting for the ambulance. Pt's mom still wanted an ambulance so one was called and EMT's came and accessed the patients vitals. Vitals were all within normal limits and EMTs spoke with mom and advised that pt most likely did not have a seizure and gave the option to transport to the hospital or monitor at home. Mom chose to monitor at home and pt was able to walk out of the store on her own.

After about 30 mins with no improvement of symptoms, 911 was contacted. Paramedics arrived and gave patient EKG, BP, Temp, and Glucose. All were within normal limits.

Administration of vaccine began at 10:46am. At 10:48, patient was observed to be pale, complained of being light headed, and was observed to be diaphoretic. She was positioned to standing at 11:00; color was observed to be pink; standing BP was 109/66. She was discharged to home at 11:20am with parents.

On the way to the area, she got dizzy again and her legs gave out and her mom was holding her up. As I came out to get her, pt was awake and responsive. Unsure if she ever actually passed out or if she was just light headed. Laid pt on the floor with feet elevated for a few minutes with a cold compress on forehead. After a few minutes, pt felt better so had her sit up still on the floor with cold compress. After a few more minutes, pt felt better and had her sit in chair and finish post IMZ wait time. Pt felt fine and left.

Close
Patient received the 1st COVID vaccine Pfizer Lot#EW0185 on 05/22/21 at 11:18AM. The patient presents to the vaccination site today for her 2nd COVID Pfizer vaccine with her mother. She alerted RN that she developed dizziness 24 hours following her 1st vaccine. RN alerted RN lead who responded. The patient told RN the dizziness lasted about one hour. She did eat prior to receiving the vaccine on 05/22/21. The patient did eat today prior to presenting to the vaccination site. The patient did not report SOB after the 1st dose of COVID vaccine Pfizer. The patient did not consume any medications for the reactions to the 1st dose. They did not follow up with any medical care providers after developing dizziness. The patient denies any chronic conditions, or current medications. The patient has no known allergies. RN consulted with the Medical Consult Team regarding the patient and her reactions to the first dose of COVID vaccine Pfizer. Approval was received from PHN via text message. RN provided education regarding s/s of anaphylaxis, to report any symptoms during observation to EMT, to follow up with PCP if the patient develops any symptoms post vaccination, to consume water prior to vaccination and after, and V-safe. The patient was also instructed to wait 30 minutes in the observation period. The patient and her mother voiced understanding of this. The patient stated she had already drank water while waiting in line pending vaccination. Patient received the 2nd COVID vaccine Pfizer Lot#EW0187 on 06/12/21 at 12:44PM. The patient waited in the observation area for 30 minutes with her mother. She did not alert the EMTs of any symptoms during her observation period.

Technician (licensed to vaccinate) administered vaccine to patient near pharmacist. 20 seconds or so after administration, patient stated felt dizzy and immediately became unresponsive and head dropped to chest. Technician stated he then lifted the patients head because he heard a "snoring" sound indicating airway may be constricted due to positioning. Technician stated the patient's body twitched and became ridged, throwing her belongings. He called pharmacist (myself) for assistance. I immediately checked for breathing and pulse, both of which were evident. I observed pt vitals for about 20 seconds before the pt opened her eyes and was responsive and able to talk to me. Blood pressure was 120/69. Pt remained in the pharmacy waiting area for 30 minutes after. Patient said that in the past she has nearly passed out from piercings she has had, but has never fainted before and has no history of seizures.
15 2021-06-16 dizziness Dizziness/lightheadedness; Nausea; Blurred vision; Terrible headache; a little palpitation; Clogged ... Read more
Close
Dizziness/lightheadedness; Nausea; Blurred vision; Terrible headache; a little palpitation; Clogged throat; this heaviness (not clarified); This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (parent). A 15-years-old non pregnant female patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Right on 15May2021 16:00 (Batch/Lot Number: EW0182) as single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included no other illness. There were no concomitant medications. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine and any other medications within 2 weeks of vaccination. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient has not been tested for COVID-19. The patient previously received Amoxicillin, Azithromicin, Cefdinir, Gardasil(Pf) and had allergy. The patient had Nausea that does not go away with Gardasil. She also received HPV vaccine previously and experienced nausea and the dizziness for a month. Reporter stated, "she did not have any allergic 'condition' (not clear) but she was allergic, she had always had a rash when she had this Amoxicillin this antibiotic. She was allergic to Penicillin." The patient had the COVID Pfizer Vaccine on 15May2021 and as soon as she had her first dose she started to feel nausea and dizziness and from there 5 days later she had, she felt a terrible headache, 'this heaviness' (not clarified), headache, dizziness, palpitation. The reporter took her to the emergency room, they did all the test and they didn't really see anything in the results. From there she cannot stop to have nausea and dizziness and clogged throat so the reporter had to give allergy medication to her every day. She did have, she never had an allergic reaction to any vaccine but the HPV vaccine (captured as unspecified vaccine in tab) what was similar to what she is experiencing now. She had nausea and the dizziness for a month that she couldn't stay in school and she has this nausea and dizziness and clogged throat she has to run for this allergy medication what normally she never needed. So, she doesn't want to take this second dose and the reporter was wondering if it is Pfizer because she was just like (Height), a (Weight) pounds if because the reporter understand the vaccine is one for everybody, isn't this strong for a kid with that height that weight, that you do not needed the second dose. The patient could not she said she will not because she goes to school and she feel the nausea and dizziness and so. The reporter would like to report it because it maybe Pfizer's that she was thinking that 1 dose would be enough for kids. When asked about the start of experiencing adverse events, the reported stated that "Well the nausea and dizziness, she was a little bit not sure about like headache right after like her we stayed there like half hours because the doctor said to stay there because she has her reaction to which but then we just the reporter felt the nausea and everything was so bright you know, the reporter had the same effect but her went away and the patient after we received she was, the whole day but not too bad, 5 days after then she but she was already with this nausea, dizziness and 5 days after she got the palpitation, bad headache, nausea, dizziness and then I took her to the emergency room." Reporter stated, "No they have improved, the only thing now left is every day she has this nausea, dizziness and then she said about dizziness and then nausea and then clogged throat and then the reporter gave her the 'allergic pill I gave that, to this allergy' (not clarified further) really she gave only 1 tablet a day." Reporter stated, "On 20May2021, they did a blood test, they did urine test, they did a ECG, so the hospital did all and the doctor too, nothing new." The reporter had lab test result on chart, she stated they put on her chart but she also had the copy of the results. Okay, here they put the result is a line on the chart. Okay here they put like linear line lab test complete, she get all the line because here they didn't put results but screen for metabolic and kidney disorder they did, they did an 'urinary tract infection' (not clarified) they have marked in the ECG. Okay you going to ask for specific (incomplete sentence)." The patient had no other illness but reporter need to know what Gardasil and Covid 19 vaccine have in common because the symptoms were very similar. Nausea that does not go away. She asked if it is the preservative or what ingredients. Never had a reaction to any other vaccine. She just wanted to call the Medical Department if she should have the vaccine on Saturday or not. On 15May2021, 4:30 AM, the patient experienced dizziness, nausea, lightheadedness, blurred vision, headache, a little palpitation (as reported). The patient received treatment Children allergy medication. Adverse events resulted in Doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit and Emergency room/department or urgent care. Outcome of the events clogged throat, heaviness was unknown and other events was not recovered.

15 2021-06-16 dizziness Client received her first dose of the Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine (Lot # EW0187 Exp. 08/2021) at 12:38 P... Read more
Close
Client received her first dose of the Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine (Lot # EW0187 Exp. 08/2021) at 12:38 PM on Wednesday 6/16/21. EMTs and Lead RN responded to the incident. Lead nurse signaled over EMT at approximately 12:44 that she needed the gravity bed for a client. The client was found lethargic when EMTs arrived with a gravity bed. The client was a 15-year-old female with a chief complaint of dizziness. Client?s older brother was present during incident. Interpreter translated information between EMTs/RN and client/client?s brother. The client was alert and tracking to voice. Per the lead nurse, the client was complaining of dizziness after the administration of her first Pfizer vaccination. The client had no known allergies or medical history. The client also did not take any medication. The client's brother stated that ?she had chicken nuggets and a smoothie? to eat at approximately 10:00. The client's brother also stated that ?they had been standing at the border crossing under the sun? for an extended period of time. The client's airway, breathing, and circulation were intact. The client was negative for hives, swelling, shortness of breath, or other signs of anaphylaxis. The client was nauseous, dizzy and complained of numbness on both arms. The client was unable to bear weight and not following simple commands before she was assisted to gravity bed by EMT and RN. The client then briefly lost consciousness for less than a minute before becoming alert to person, place, date, and event. EMTs assessed vital signs every 5 minutes for a total duration of a 45-minute observation. Vital signs were taken by EMT with client lying supine immediately after losing consciousness (12:45) and were reported as follows: Blood Pressure (BP) 92/64, Pulse (P) 66, Oxygen Saturation (O2) 99%, Temperature (T) 98. Skin was intact, pale, and cool to touch immediately following patient regaining consciousness. Patient remained lying flat on gravity bed for approximately 10 minutes before she was assisted to a seated position. Patient was in a high-fowlers position when she was given a juice and granola bar. Client then stated that she was ?feeling better?. After an additional 10 minutes sitting on the gravity bed in high-fowlers position, the patient was assisted by RN and EMT from vaccination station to EMT/observation station. The client remained seated in the EMT/observation station for an additional 15 minutes. Vital signs were taken every 5 minutes during this time by EMT. They were reported as follows: 12:51- BP 112/78, P 69, O2 97%, T 98. 12:55- BP 108/78, P 77, O2 99%, T 97.9. 13:00- BP 104/78, P 66, O2 98%, T 98.1. 13:05- BP 96/62, P 83, O2 95%, T 98.1. 13:10- BP 92/68, P 76, O2 98%, T 98.1. 13:20- BP 90/70, P 92, O2 99%, T 97.6. 13:28- BP 92/72, P 93, O2 99%, T 97.9. After a 45-minute observation, client stated her condition was improving and was observed walking normally. Client?s skin color returned to a pale pink and became warm to the touch. Client denied dizziness or any other symptoms. Lead RN educated the client about what to do if symptoms returned. The client was provided with the V-Safe form and EUA form with highlighted portions pertaining to symptoms to be mindful of. The client was also instructed to call 9-1-1 if symptoms of anaphylaxis, also known as a severe allergic reaction, presented. These symptoms include difficulty breathing, shortness of breath, hives covering body, facial swelling and more. Client and client?s brother acknowledged understanding of information. The client?s brother stated that he would ?drive her straight home?. The client then left facility at approximately 13:33 with her older brother in positive disposition with steady gait.
15 2021-06-17 dizziness PATIENT SHOWED UP FOR THE APPOINTMENT FOR HER 2ND DOSE. WHILE GOING THROUGH THE , EVEN THOUGH PATIEN... Read more
Close
PATIENT SHOWED UP FOR THE APPOINTMENT FOR HER 2ND DOSE. WHILE GOING THROUGH THE , EVEN THOUGH PATIENT (PARENT) MARKED NO ALLERGIES, I ALWAYS STILL RECONFIRM WITH PATIENT THAT THERE IS NO ALLERGY. PATIENT WITH HER PARENT (MOM AND DAD) PRESENT INDICATED THAT SHE HAD LOST LIP COLOR (PALE), VOMITING, DIZZINESS, SHORTNESS OF BREATH. PATIENT WENT TO THE ER AND HER BLOOD PRESSURE WAS LOW AND HAD IV GIVEN TO HER. SHE WAS RELEASED THE SAME DAY. PATIENT DID NOT CALL THE PHARMACY AFTER THE REACTION. PATIENT IS ALSO NOT SURE IF THE ER HAD REPORTED IT. FOR THIS REASON WE ARE REPORTING THIS EVENT.

15 2021-06-20 dizziness Upon leaving the store approximately 15 minutes after receiving vaccination, patient told her father... Read more
Close
Upon leaving the store approximately 15 minutes after receiving vaccination, patient told her father that she felt she was having an issue with her vision and was feeling faint. Her father was able to support her as she fainted and was lowered gently to the ground in front of the store. A pharmacy technician was leaving the store simultaneously and upon witnessing the event ran back to the pharmacy to tell me I was needed to assist. When I arrived, the patient was alert and breathing and able to answer questions regarding personal information, date, time and location. Patient stated she felt normal other than some tingling sensation in her hands. Patient reported that she hadn't eaten anything since waking up that morning. EMS was already en route, and I observed the patient until they arrived. Patient has since been transported to the hospital and is currently reported in stable condition.

Close
At 1443 EMT observed client leaning forward in chair and approached for further assessment. Client mentioned feeling dizzy. PHN arrived at 1445 and observed client sitting upright in chair, alert and oriented x4. PHN asked EM to bring anti-gravity chair. Client able to transfer to anti-gravity on her own. First vitals by EMT at 1445: blood pressure 148/86, pulse 92, oxygen sat 100%. Grandmother present with client. Client reported feeling dizzy and nauseous. Client denied headache, blurry vision, shortness of breath. PHN observed hives on neck, bilateral arms, chest and upper left back. PHN offered Benadryl, Grandmother accepted and stated she would go get Father who was outside. Father denied client having allergies, no pertinent medical history or current medications. At 1448 PHN administered 1ml/50mg Benadryl IM on right deltoid after checking dosage table and verifying weight with client. PHN called 911 at 1449. At 1452 client reported new onset of tingling on both hands. Client appeared pale and diaphoretic. Vitals at 1452 by EMT: blood pressure 150/90, pulse 108, oxygen sat 100%. Hives on bilateral arms improving, hives on upper left back resolved. Flushing of face and ears. 1456 PHN and EMT observe edema of lower lip. PHN on phone with 911 operator asked client if she was having trouble swallowing. Client unable to fully describe, drowsy, but was speaking in full coherent sentences. Patient began to slouch upon sitting in the waiting seat approximately 1-2 minutes after receiving their second dose of the COVID19 (Pfizer\BioNTech) vaccination. Pharmacist immediately assisted patient and instructed for technician to call 9-1-1 immediately. We were able to catch the patient as they were falling out of the seat. Patient then began to seize for 5 seconds. Post seizure the patient was pale but cognizant and able to answer questions correctly (i.e. Name, DOB). Patient then began vomiting profusely. Patient reported no history of seizures, however reported previous an episode of fainting 3 years ago due to heat. Patient was monitored, given bag for emesis, water for rehydration, and ice pack until EMS came.

15 2021-06-26 dizziness Client received dose 1 of the COVID19 Pfizer vaccine (Lot# EW0187 Exp 08/31/21) at 13:32 from RN1. ... Read more
Close
Client received dose 1 of the COVID19 Pfizer vaccine (Lot# EW0187 Exp 08/31/21) at 13:32 from RN1. RN1 reported that within 5 seconds of receiving the vaccine, the client reported she felt dizzy and experienced a syncopal episode for 2-3 seconds. As the syncopal episode was occurring, ancillary staff, requested RN2 radio for a Lead Nurse & EMT. At 13:34 Lead RN arrived at station 6, radioed for an EMT, and observed client sitting up in the vaccination chair being held by her mother and RN1. Lead RN noted client?s head was down with her eyes open, exhibiting pallor and was diaphoretic. Lead RN asked client her name and how she was feeling. Client did not respond. Co-Lead RN entered the room at 13:35. RN1, Lead RN, Co-Lead RN, and client?s mother guided client to the floor, laid her in a supine position, lifting her legs and feet on a chair. Co-Lead RN removed client?s mask, continued to ask client her name. Within 2-3 seconds of repositioning client, she became responsive and alert & oriented to person, place, time, and event. Client also immediately stated, ?I?m fine.? EMT1, EMT2, and EMT3 came to the station at 13:36 with a zero-gravity chair. The EMTs assisted client into the zero-gravity chair. Client?s mother stated client has no underlying health conditions, no allergies, and that birth control is the only medication the client takes. The client confirmed this by nodding her head in agreeance. EMT2 gave client a bottle of water and the client immediately started drinking the water. Lead RN asked client if she had eaten or drank anything today. Client?s mother stated she did not realize her daughter had not eaten or drank anything prior to coming to get vaccinated. Client stated she was given a granola bar downstairs at check-in and ate it before receiving the vaccine. At 13:45 EMT1 took vitals. Both EMT1 & EMT2 were unable to obtain client?s blood pressure (HR:61, O2Sat: 97%). Lead RN asked client and her mother what the client?s normal blood pressure is. Client and her mother did not know, and client?s mother indicated that the client is an athlete in good shape. At 13:48, EMT3 took client?s blood pressure, which was 100/60. Client?s mother stated client was anxious about being vaccinated and has fainted when anxious in the past, but the last time was around 5 years ago. Client stated she was feeling better and no longer feeling dizzy. Client stated she just ?feels hot.? Lead RN brought client an ice pack to put behind her neck and damp paper towels to wipe her face with. At 13:59 EMT3 took client?s vitals (BP: 118/70, HR: 65, O2Sat 98%). Lead RN observed that client?s color was returning to her face and client was less diaphoretic. Client finished her bottled water and was given another by EMT2, which she started drinking. Lead RN asked client if she felt she could stand up. Client stood up and stated she was ?feeling fine.? At 14:05 all 3 EMTs escorted client and her mother to the observation room where she was monitored for an additional 30 minutes. At 14:30 Lead RN went to the observation room where EMT1was taking client?s vitals (BP: 110/70, HR: 60, SPO2 Sat 98%). Lead RN observed that client?s color had fully returned, and client was no longer diaphoretic. Client stated she ?felt fine? and was hungry. Client?s mother stated she would take client to get something to eat and EMT2 gave client an additional snack that client took with her when she left. Client and her mother left at 14:30. Client was walking with a steady gait when she exited the building.

Patient slowly returned to a normal state after about 30 minutes but was still slow to respond.

Administered is Pharmacy or Drug Store. Medical history included asthma and no known allergies. Historical vaccine included bnt162b2 (BNT162B2), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 30May2021 11:00 at age of 15 years old (Batch/Lot Number: EW0196) as Dose 1, SINGLE for covid-19 immunisation. She was bleeding excessively and extreme cramps. It maybe a coincidence. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. After her 2nd covid shot on 20Jun2021 around 12 noon. Around 8 pm she started screaming in pain, hunched over, feeling nauseous and dizzy. Patient had clinic visit, ended up taking to ER where they gave her morphine for pain. They started IV, did bloodwork, ultrasound and ct scan with contrast all on 20Jun2021. They said it was an ovarian cyst rupture. Patient was only 15 years old and has had her period for 3 years and has never experienced anything like what she has in the last month. She is due for her next period on 29Jun21 and pray it's not as bad as last month after the shot. They do believe in science, but also think should study menstrual cycles with this shot. They pray this was just a fluke, but patient has never experienced pain or severe periods like this until shot. Treatment received for all events. The outcome of events was not recovered. Information on Lot/Batch number was available. Additional information has been requested

Around 9 AM, my daughter came downstairs and said her legs felt heavy. She sat down and then she said she was really hot. She was also sweating and pale. She said that she felt like she was about to pass out and that she couldn't see. She also said she couldn't focus, that she was seeing stars, and everything looked black. My husband and I told her to lay down on the couch. We gave her a rag to put on her head to cool her down and we got her some water to drink. She said she had a headache and we gave her some Tylenol.
15 2021-07-13 dizziness ABOUT 5-10 MINUTES AFTER THE DOSE WAS ADMINISTERED THE PATIENT STARTED FEELING FAINT. SHE HAD WALKE... Read more
Close
ABOUT 5-10 MINUTES AFTER THE DOSE WAS ADMINISTERED THE PATIENT STARTED FEELING FAINT. SHE HAD WALKED AWAY FROM THE PHARMACY AFTER THE BROTHER WAS GIVEN A SHOT AND THE PARENTS HELPED HER TO THE FLOOR. SHE PASSED OUT. SHE HAD WORKED OUT TODAY AND NOT EATEN OR WAS NOT WELL HYDRATED PRIOR TO VACCINE WHICH MAY HAVE CONTRIBUTED TO THE SYNCOPE. SHE CAME TO AND PASSED OUT ABOUT 15 LATER THIS TIME WAS SITTING IN THE CHAIR. THE MEDIC TEAM ARRIVED SHORTLY AFTERWARDS AND ASSESSED THE PATIENT. SHE WAS NOT TAKEN TO THE ER BUT INSTEAD THE PARENTS WANTED TO TAKE HER HOME.
15 2021-07-14 dizziness The patient started to feel dizzy almost right away, we had her sit, she was sweating and pale and h... Read more
Close
The patient started to feel dizzy almost right away, we had her sit, she was sweating and pale and had black visions in front of her eyes. We gave her water and after a few minutes she started feeling better but we called 911 anyway. When they came her blood pressure was 80/54 and they gave her IV fluids right away and decided to take her to the ER for observation.
15 2021-07-14 dizziness PATIENT GOT VACCINE AND STARTED FEELING DIZZINESS AND VOMITING. PATIENT WAS HAVING DIFFICULTY BREATH... Read more
Close
PATIENT GOT VACCINE AND STARTED FEELING DIZZINESS AND VOMITING. PATIENT WAS HAVING DIFFICULTY BREATHING. CALLED 911 AND IN LESS THEN 5 MINUTES THEY ARRIVED. PATIENTS BP WAS 80/50 AND TOOK HER TO THE HOSPITAL
15 2021-07-14 dizziness Called by observation nurse to see client who complained of lightheadedness after receiving 2nd dose... Read more
Close
Called by observation nurse to see client who complained of lightheadedness after receiving 2nd dose of vaccine. Client was alert and talking. Given ammonia to smell and sips of H2O. VS BP 73/34, P 66, O2Sat 98%, Client legs were elevated w/ little improvement. Said she felt better after decreased dizziness. Vital signs taken at 11:25am: T 94.4, O2Sat 90%, Pulse 59, client appeared less lethargic and did not voice any new complaints. Given water for hydration as BP was 71/48. At 11:30am Rescue arrived from previous call made. Client stood up with ambulance tech and walked to ambulance where she was evaluated. Dad was with client throughout visit and with ambulance personnel. Mgr. and writer was informed that client would be going home with her father at 11:47am.

Updated: July 26, 2021
